Reviews.Title: “Good But a Little Dark.....”
Reviews.Author: MJCDN
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night this past week while in Montreal for business. Very contemporary feel to the hotel. Great bar and restaurant area (KOKO) Staff were friendly. Only a couple of things....This hotel still charges for WiFi...c'mon folks really!! As well the rooms are very dark...great for the contemporary image and feel but really not functional. Good location for business on the North side of Downtown but not if you are meeting in Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location, great service and peacefull sleep”
Reviews.Author: Eric P
Reviews.Content: I will definetly be back this summer for the Jazz or the just for laugh festival. Great location in the heart of Montreal. At my arrival the valet help me with my luggage and direct me to the front desk. 3 Beautiful smiling lady has there for me. Very spacious, confortable and clean room. Confort food breakfast and deliciious cappucino. I recommand this property for leisure and business trip.

Reviews.Title: “I understand why this place is bankrupt”
Reviews.Author: Heather T
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel-yes. The service here is great. Ameneties, not so much. This hotel doesn't even have a computer for guests, which I found shocking. The rooms don't have a TV with demand (they just have basic cable) and the there is a serious sound issue here. We had to move rooms after the first night because the floors were literally shaking from the club beats below us. I get the impression that people come here to party- in fact, we had a party going on in the room across from us until 5am! I also get the impression that this hotel is experiencing an identity crisis of some sort. You walk into this beautiful lounge/restaurant- the decorations and design are gorgeous and then you see the chairs at the tables and they are PLASTIC!! Like... lawn chair style. We just couldn't dine there because of this. I came to the conclusion that club and 4-5 star hotel do not mix. This type of mix is best suited for a hostel or lower end hotel with rooms at 60-80$ a night. The hotel is trying to attract young people with money.... problem is, there aren't enough young rich kids out there to keep this hotel a-float. If they improved their amenities, changed their club into a lounge (And JUST a lounge) and classed up their restaurant a bit, they may have a chance. Young professionals would love it hear, but the bottom line is: people need to sleep. The ear plugs beside the beds say it all.

Reviews.Title: “nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexVT
Reviews.Content: The main reason to go there was our voucher from Travelzoo, it included 1 night stay, valet parking and dinner â€“ all for $199, pretty good deal. The hotel is fine, very nice easy check in. as it was mid-week, they were not very busy. We got there at 4pm and the room was ready. The â€œvalet guyâ€� (sorry, I am terrible with names) was just great â€“ friendly, funny, lots of good advice. The room was clean, spacious (though only one robe and one bedside lamp, but that was enough for us for one night, I did not complain). Bathroom was awesome â€“ deep soaking bath and separate large shower. Bright, fresh, modern. The restaurant looked very nicely decorated, but food was so-so. We liked the location and weâ€™ll probably stay there another time.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, wonderful breakfast, just as advertised”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S
Reviews.Content: We used a Gilt City voucher and had a wonderful experience. Called about a week in advance to request a room away from the restaurant/club (as recommended by other previous reviewers, thank you!) The staff accommodated us perfectly. We were on the 3rd floor (4th floor to Americans) and on the side of the hotel away from the club (to the left of the elevators, room 326). We didn't hear anything and appreciated that they had given us a room on the other side of the hotel since we did venture along our floor to the other side of the hotel and noticed quite a bit of noise coming through. The staff was very helpful, we arrived late and had a valet take our car almost immediately. Check in was a breeze. The concierge gave us a great restaurant recommendation and made the reservation for us. No surprise charges at the end. Overall a great experience. Oh, and the beds are INCREDIBLY comfy! As long as you don't stay above the club, this hotel offers a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy even from the 5th floor”
Reviews.Author: vitaeterna
Reviews.Content: The hotel was okay. The TV is almost unusable as the remote is so hard to use. The noise from the club 5 floors down was quite loud considering the distance. You could even hear people talking. I think the steel in the building is conducting the sound or the sound insulation of the windows is not high enough.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location, Beautiful Building, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: MItch_in_Ottawa
Reviews.Content: The building is stunning. Really well done. We loved the room and the staff were super helpful and exceptionally friendly compared to a lot of hotel staff I've encountered. If you're looking for a quiet room you probably want to take one away from the St.Laurent side of the building. The location could not be much better, immediately beside the Just For Laughs and a short walk from excellent restaurants. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loud loud loud (and unhelpful) - Do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: janet m
Reviews.Content: We did not sleep at all our first night here, despite requesting and receiving a room far from the club. The room still shook until 3 am, and then the guests took the party back to their rooms until 7 am. Management did not respond to repeated requests to deal with the parties in the rooms next to us or the hall. The street noise was also unbearable - screeching, hooting, police breaking up disturbances in the street. The next night the club was closed but guests still partied unchecked till all hours. The hotel is nice enough, though the bathrooms are very small with no tubs or anywhere to even hang a towel and the rooms are so dimly lit you can barely see. I would not return or recommend. There are plenty of great hotels at better prices in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend at Opus Montreal”
Reviews.Author: MAVDM
Reviews.Content: Trip was part business part pleasure. Perfect location. Unassuming entrance leading to a fabulous overall hotel experience. The room was spacious and very well appointed and clean. Service was excellent. Would definitely recommend and stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel but.........”
Reviews.Author: JohnED58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Opus Montreal on Friday and Saturday nights just this past weekend Feb.2012. Except for the limited drop-off area in front of the hotel on busy Sherbrooke Street, the reception was warm and helpful and the room exceeded our expectations - modern and chic with many creature comforts including a Keurig coffer/tea maker and a small fridge in the room. Dinner at Koko's Restaurant Friday evening was delicious and the ambiance perfect. We were told at check-in that the hotel is a lively nightclub on the weekends and were given a room on the side of the hotel (Clark Street) away from the loud music. This proved to be prophetic as, by around two in the morning, the din of the pounding music was audible and kept us awake. This was nothing compared to Saturday night when around three o'clock we were awakened by what first was a lot of shouting and then police sirens as a melee of drunk patrons spilled into the street only to end in hospitalized bar employees and many detained participants taken away on a 'special' city bus. We mentioned the evening's 'entertainment' to the front desk at check-out and it was then they admitted, somewhat sheepishly, that this particular Saturday night was inordinately violent and exceptional. Was it? Why is a fine boutique hotel in an excellent location with a trendy restaurant serving taste-tempting food being tarnished by the unbridled hedonism of its lucrative bar. Control and coordination of the restaurant/bar vis-a-vis the hotel operation should be management's top priority or risk losing the upscale tony facade it attempts to project to the public. If we had wanted a raucous beer-swilling brawl to punctuate our evening hours, we could have sojourned in Sudbury on a Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at Opus Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Aurelie V
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located and decorated. Rooms are so cosy! The staff was was very helpful too. My only advice is to make sure you get a room at the highest floor (which we got) if you stay on a Friday or Saturday night because the hotel bar turns into a crowded nightclub during the weekend. I would definitively return there if I ever go back to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Opus Hotel”
Reviews.Author: headingsomeplace
Reviews.Content: Room had a Zen feel to it and was well furnished. Bathroom was wonderful. We had a room close to the elevators, so there was a bit of noise as partiers got off on our floor and went to their rooms. Hotel provides ear plugs in each room for this eventuality and becaue the hotel is on a busy street. Hotel staff were very helpful and very well dressed and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but VERY loud on weekends!”
Reviews.Author: TravelersFromNJ225
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opus Hotel with another couple in November on a Friday-Sunday for a Travelzoo promotion. The hotel has a great location and we were able to walk to many of the main attractions. The rooms were very nice with trendy decor and loved the shower too! The only downside was the noise. We are a young couple in our late 20's, so not usually ones to complain about the noise because we are usually out late ourselves...but we honestly didn't fall asleep until 3am both nights because the hotel's club was right underneath us and I felt like I was in the club trying to sleep. I could literally sing along to every song they played. The hotel actually provided us with earplugs on our nightstand each night, thought that was kind of amusing when we first saw them...until we actually had to use them. I'm not sure if they placed us right above the club because they saw we are younger, or maybe because we had a discount deal, but we kept commenting to each other that if anyone our parent's age stayed here (or anyone looking for a good night's sleep for that matter) they would be outraged. Maybe there are quieter floors in the hotel, but we were on the 4th floor over the club and the noise was definitely an issue. We did not ask to change rooms after the first night because we didn't want to go through the hassle because we were in an adjoining room next to friends. We had a blast in Montreal and made light of the experience, but I just wanted to be honest with my experience and warn others who may not be so liberal with the noise issue on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Sundays to Thursdays”
Reviews.Author: MarcotheRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: Stayed in October 2011.Great service. Arrived just after midnight and front desk offered water and luggage assistance. Function room and banquet food was great. Room was fairly large, and turndown service was nice touch along with the water they leave in the guestroom. Would be a 5/5 if it wasn't for the loud music on Friday/Saturday from Koko Lounge. Location was great, close to several nightclubs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique style hotel, will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: ubergirlcanada
Reviews.Content: This was a very good boutique hotel. Great Location, amazing service, large rooms with chic amenities. Would stay again as it was easy access to all downtown restaurants, shopping and suited my business requirements quite well. Complimentary wifi and turndown service was a welcome bonus. Staff, in particular Lucas, was extremely helpful and went out his way to assist. Would not recommend the Koko restaurant which is attached to the hotel, although it had nice atomsphere and food was quite good the service was abysmal. The waiters were not busy and yet they provided bare minimum service, very disappointing in that venue and price point.

Reviews.Title: “best stay of our lives!”
Reviews.Author: amandaeagles
Reviews.Content: our stay at the opus was absolutely amazing from the time we pulled up until the time we pulled away. Such a modern hotel, perfect for a getaway in montreal. Relaxing and yet energizing at the same time. Wish we never had to leave!

Reviews.Title: “One of Montreal's best”
Reviews.Author: Mamielu
Reviews.Content: Located downtown Montreal at a five minutes walk to "Place des Arts", the new OSM concert hall, theatres and Museums. Friendly, helping and courteous staff, large and well decorated rooms and a restaurant (called KoKo) with excellent food. Very quiet during our stay (2 days). Personnel of the hotel give you the impression that they care for their guests and do their best to satisfy their needs. A. Saulnier Mont Tremblant

Reviews.Title: “excellant”
Reviews.Author: R02010
Reviews.Content: beautifully located right on st-laurent the heart of downtown montreal. amazing supperclub located inside the hotel called KoKo. the rooms are very luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you're expecting peace and quiet”
Reviews.Author: CJM0019
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent the weekend at the Opus Montreal during December of this year- we had never been to Montreal and were thrilled at the quality of the hotel. The lobby was beautiful as were the rooms. We got an excellent price on the room and felt as if we more or less got our money's worth. The bar in KOKO made some of the best drinks either of us has ever had and the bathroom in our room was exquisite. Our principal complaints were the noise and lighting (or lack thereof) in the room. The club downstairs plays LOUD LOUD music until about 4 am every night and you can hear it pretty much anywhere. When people slip outside for a cigarette and the doors open the noise is even worse. They even supply earplugs in each room if that tells you something. The bedroom had NO overhead lighting which made reading a book, magazine or information on our tours pretty much impossible unless it was daytime and the shades were open.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Very Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Zornkatzu
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ©e and I recently stayed at the Opus Hotel in Montreal for one night for a weekend getaway. We used a Groupon Voucher to book the room, and check-in was very quick, and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Our room was very beautifully decorated and spacious, and the television had a surprisingly-decent selection of English programming (considering the primarily Francophone population). Our voucher included complimentary drinks at the attached Koko's Lounge, which was also beautifully decorated and friendly. The hotel is located right across the street from a small Tim Hortons (always a plus) and a short 5 minute walk to the St. Laurent Metro Station, which brought us to the Biodome in less than 10 minutes! In the morning, we went downstairs to a delicious continental breakfast, including bacon, eggs, sausages, croissants and other breakfast staples. Much like check-in, check-out was also very fast and friendly, and the valet parking attendant was particularly cordial: he even held open the passenger door for my fiancÃ©e upon returning my car to us! Not everything was perfect. One particular negative was that the neighbourhood was very noisy, even at night (ear plus are included in the room). As well, there are no ice machines for customer use; you have to call down and order a bucket of ice be delivered to you. A fancy gesture, but a hotel staple like an ice machine would have been preferred. Overall, if you're looking for a nice place to stay when visiting the St. Laurent area of Montreal (or anywhere along the Green Line Metro) then the Opus Hotel is a great choice, particularly for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: citysee
Reviews.Content: Once again Opus is a clear winner. This time I stayed 5 fabulous days. The room was beautiful, spacious, modern, exceptionally clean and well maintained, and inviting. From the luxurious king bed and down duvet to the warm terry robe provided and the coffee machine, comfort and convenience is the word at the Opus Hotel. The staff is ever helpful; whether it's a computer connection, printing a boarding pass or asking directions. Someone is always available quickly with a smile. The breakfast buffet is great; sensational coffee and beautifully prepared foods to start your day in the exquisite environs of the restaurant/lounge COCO. What a way to start and end your day! Off to shop or sightsee or visit family/friends, THe Opus is so centrally located. It's an easy walk or a short cab or subway ride..ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Opus Hotel + Koko Lounge = P.A.R.T.Y”
Reviews.Author: katzlife
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Montreal for the Just For Laughs Festival July 2011 and stayed at the Opus hotel. Location is fantastic for being in the hub of things and even walking down into old montreal. Definitely check out Jardin Nelson in old Montreal and hang out on the patio in the back! Open-air tiered patios, with live jazz and the best sangrias I have ever had!!! Anyways, the Opus is definitely well-suited to Montreal with it's modern decor and sleek design, and the Koko lounge is the main event of this hotel. The lounge is also open air and functions as a restaurant during the day and then a club with live DJ at night. It seems to be THE place to be and be seen, and on Friday nights the club will be packed and lined up out the door all night. Security ensures that not just anyone can enter the hotel and if you are a guest of the hotel, your name will be placed on the list, allowing you to enter before the rest of the line! The hotel gives out ear plugs, but if you are a light...or moderate sleeper.....or value sleep at all, you must request to be away from the lounge. One of the best aspects of this hotel are the concierge that stand outside the hotel to assist guests with their day plans. They offered everything from bottle of water to information about where we could go to really experience Montreal (hence the Jardin Nelson location I mentioned earlier). HTH!

Reviews.Title: “Montreal in March”
Reviews.Author: IshraSharif
Reviews.Content: Already a fan of the Opus Hotel in Vancouver, it was no question to stay at Opus Hotel Montreal for my first time in Quebec. Located within walking distance to boutiques, just a cab ride away to Old Montreal and near the best nightlife spots. Management was kind enough to book me in a room that was much larger than I needed - the bathroom was almost as large as the bedroom with 2 sinks - perfect for couples or a girls getaway, glass-encased shower, a huge tub, a comfy king bed and set everything up at Koko Cafe for a business meeting. Everything from beginning to end went smoothly with follow-up via Twitter during my stay and a phone call post-trip. Everything I have come to expect from Opus and more. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “great location! but had issues...”
Reviews.Author: Claudia O
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a VERY convenient location right by St Laurent Street where all the action is, niteclubs and restaurants. the KOKO lounge attached to the hotel is fantastic, great service and excellent food for a very affordable price. once we got to bed, at 3am, the noise from the club people loitering around was very LOUD in our rooms on the 2nd floor and there was also a lot of clubbers walking through the hallways slamming doors and speaking loudly. So make sure you are a clubber yourself if you want a good nites sleep, at least on the weekend not sure how it is during the week. My problem with the hotel mostly was this....after getting back from the club at 4am and the lobby being completely empty, a couple of us decided to lounge in the lobby lounge area and talk. Completely sober. We were very quiet and yet were told we only had 10mins to sit in the lobby as it "doesnt look good for the hotel image to have people sitting in the lobby late at nite" i was VERY CONFUSED by this as the lobby was not only completely EMPTY but is FILLED with all types of couches and chairs to lounge in. Im a guest at the hotel, i wasnt being disruptive, im a grown woman, and yet i was told i had to leave after 10minutes. I found this very difficult to understand or accept. Regardless i did as asked but want to warn everyone of this as its embaressing to be told to leave by management...not something i would want to experience again. I would have complained to a supervisor but it was too late at night and i was too annoyed to bother. the first room with a KING bed we were put in was gorgeous, but we had 3ppl so had to be moved to a room with 2 beds, this room wasnt as nice. The lighting is very DIM and its hard to see, the paint was coming off the walls, and the shower had ZERO pressure. they do have a breakfast included in the morning which my friends took advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChubbyBunny69
Reviews.Content: Opus hotel is the nicest hotel that we have stayed in. They put us in one of their best rooms and it was incredible. The bathroom alone was the size of a normal hotel room. In addition to a tub, the bathroom also had a rainfall shower which was especially relaxing after a long day of walking while on vacation. The room was located on a busy corner. That gave a us great views of the city but it was also a bit noisy. But we were given complimentary ear plugs and didn't hear a thing. Brunch in the morning was also a treat. The front desk staff and brunch staff were helpful and professional. It was pricey but now it's a great memory.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: The Opus is a perfect spot for those who want to explore the heart of Montreal Centreville. It's perfectly located at St Laurent and Sherbrooke which provides optimal access to the heart of Montreals nightlife scene. The rooms are clean and comfortable which is a must for me when I select a hotel. All in all the location provides perfect access to- and also a great retreat from- the Montreal scene. A 5/5 for the urban socialite looking for a good time and a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap attempt at luxury”
Reviews.Author: CanadaFilm
Reviews.Content: We just celebrated our fifth wedding anniversary w/ a one-night stay in Montreal. With a new baby, we haven't gotten out much and decided to treat ourselves. I purchased a "jaunt" deal, which included a one-night stay, free valet parking, cocktails upon arrival, a bottle of wine & cheese plate, and breakfast at Koko. We arrived around 6:30 in the evening. The front desk staff were accommodating, but not overly welcoming. We were offered a glass of wine each or bottle of water, we opted for wine but were told they didn't have enough glasses so they would send it up to our room. Okay, no problem â€“ the glasses of wine never arrived. After about 20 minutes of waiting in our room, I called down to the front desk to ask about the bottle of wine we were supposed to get. The girl I spoke with curtly replied "well we don't keep it in the room, I can send it up if you want." Literally one full hour went by before the bottle of wine and cheese plate arrived. The wine was decent, so that was a plus. Great location, we headed out for supper, got back to our room around midnight and of course the must was LOUD! We were on the fifth floor and I'm deaf in one ear and still had a hard time with the noise level. The next morning we headed down for breakfast and were told by the same rude girl at the front desk that we weren't entitled to breakfast vouchers with our deal. I explained that the deal I bought clearly said breakfast at the restaurant. She interrupted me to say "listen, it's not a big deal, just take these vouchers and go." I felt totally demeaned, like I'm trying to rip her off for a freaking buffet breakfast? Give me a break! The food was cold, the cheap plastic lawn chairs in the restaurant were very tacky. The rooms are decorated to look urban and cool and appealing at first, but the dim lighting eventually reveals that the black tiles in the bathroom are actually painted black (over tile and grout and all...) with what looks like tremclad. The carpet is thread-bare and the single macaron on my pillow was pretty lame when there are clearly 2 guests. Save yourself the $200+ / night and stay in a real hotel. This was the least-friendly experience I've had in a long time, and would never consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wednesday at Opus”
Reviews.Author: KarenOhCanada
Reviews.Content: First stay at the Opus in Montreal (via travelzoo offer) and loved it. The staff were wonderful, food in dining room was great (huge portions--next time we'd each get an appetizer and then split the Bolagnese so as not waste such tasty pasta), and beautiful design everywhere we looked. Loved the toiletries (d'Occitane), the massive king-sized bed which was very comfortable, the orange walls with the dark furniture, and the big, recessed window. We were on the fifth floor on a Wednesday night and there were no noise issues, other than the usual street noise that you hear in any downtown hotel that isn't in a dead zone. Loved it so much that we have decided to book in for a couple of nights in the near future and spend some time exploring the neighbourhood's galleries and shops, as it looked really interesting. By the way--we are definitely not hipsters; I arrived looking downright frumpy and the staff were impeccable towards us! Oh--husband loved the walk-in shower and I loved the huge soaker tub that was actually, for once in a hotel, deep enough for the water to be well above shoulders!

Reviews.Title: “Review Opus Hotel and Dinner”
Reviews.Author: patriciamarkwick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel on one of the Travelzoo offers which included dinner for 2, a glass of wine each on arrival and a night at the hotel. I found the service to be outstanding. The staff were very helpful, we had some computer issues with our laptop and the staff allowed us to check our flight information and email on their computer. There was complimentary coffee in the lobby in the am, fruit in the fitness area which was very much appreciated. I would definitly stay at this hotel again. The Travelzoo offers have never left us disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Caroline2213
Reviews.Content: I had a reaaly great stay at the OPUS Montreal. Yves, the Director of Sales took extra care of me. All other staff were courteous and helpful as well. The room was super cool, very trendy and comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: pacific19
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a weekend at the OPUS and it was fantastic. I have stayed at the OPUS over 200 times for business. I had the option to stay at many different hotels in the city, but the OPUS kept me coming back due to its service. I must say that things have also improved, with recent renovations and excellent service at the breakfast (make sure you get a package with breakfast, it is great!). It is a true boutique experience with a great vibe, excellent staff and pleasing decor.

Reviews.Title: “crisp boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: restleswanderer
Reviews.Content: first visit, easy parking, just drive up and valet takes your car. He s the one with the pink inserts in his shoes. Check in very quick. Secure elevators, need room key to operate. Nice room great bed only window let in a lot of noise and when heat adjusted nothing happened. Bar drinks were ok, as for breakfast, forget it. The pre made scrambled eggs were blue and looked like cement mix, they got a fresh batch and it was not much better. Bacon all stuck together in a large pile, needed forks to seperate. Coffee ok. buns and crossants fresh. Good location and their limo was ready to take you anywhere within reason anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel with Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Iska W
Reviews.Content: I opted for the Opus Hotel Montreal instead of the usual corporate bland hotel. The atmosphere was lovely and very modern. The staff were incredible â€“ so very welcoming and helpful. From the moment I stepped out of the cab I felt taken care of. The decore is modern and fun. Every time I needed help someone was there to assist me - with an umbrella or a taxi or just a smile and a "how are you?". This hotel has a certain energy to it which I found exciting. the area is alive with resturants, shops, clubs and bars - just a short walk to something fun or you can always just go to the bar downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Group On deal”
Reviews.Author: femmej
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to share what I found to be a pretty frustrating experience with trying to use a Group On i had purchased to stay at this hotel. I first called the hotel directly to make a reservation, I had a deluxe room all booked and then following directions about how to use the group on I told the woman I was speaking too that i would be using my Group On. I was astonished when she said oh I see, well we are not able to accomodate you after all. I went back to my group on and read all the fine print then decided to try following the link provided. The reservation online went fine until it asked me for my group on #. When I provided it it told me it was no longer valid and that any booking had to be done by a date already gone by. Needless to say I was pissed! It did not say anything anywhere for that particular coupon that it had to be booked by a certain date, only when it need to be used. I am happy to say that Group On was excellent about refunding my money. I noticed today on a new Opus Hotel Group on that there is not a date that it has to be booked by...hurray!

Reviews.Title: “complimentary ear plugs say it all”
Reviews.Author: Jessimiah
Reviews.Content: about this noisy hotel full of obnoxious hipsters. Amidst the sleep deprived begging the desk clerks for quiet rooms was a staff member who kept spraying the lobby with toxic (bug spray?) The hotel dining room and bar was closed to hotel guests due to a function at the hotel. Couldn't even get a much needed drink at the bar to cope with the place. Management has a dismissive uncaring attitude toward guests although lamely agreeing that the hotel should not be closed to guests who have little else to do than listen to the din of street traffic and thumping base.

Reviews.Title: “Attempt at boutique that doesn't quite pull it off”
Reviews.Author: swizzleman
Reviews.Content: Opus Hotel Montreal is in a good central location. Staff were friendly, beds was comfortable, and modern shower was nice. However, we found the room unpleasant to be in: Purple walls with concrete ceilings and dark brown furniture. There is little light in the room even in the daytime, making reading or just relaxing difficult. It is supposed to be stylish, but it doesn't pull it off. The breakfast was cafeteria quality, and the catering at the conference was similarly generic.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before paying big bucks”
Reviews.Author: Alla-Rustica
Reviews.Content: Good: design, location, chic. Bad: loud base fron the lounge audible even in outside-view rooms, breakfast is 'quaffable', it's starting to get tired carpets, interior paint and finishes. I really liked the concrete ceilings, the decor and the staff shoes. It's a great place to see and to be seen, but it really bugged me that given the loudness of the lounge's base until 2am, staff started to strip the breakfast buffet at 10am when it is supposed to be over at 10:30. Plus I found it mediocre and unreplenished. Our carpet had mysterious stains, there are chips on the walls and the cork wall covers have had more than a few knicks. Some of the reception staff are pompous and some, like doorman Romeo, extremely helpful and resourceful. Will definitely try something else before I stay here again. Seriously, furniture vibrates with their base, MOREOVER, as a guest, you could not even enjoy a drink at the lounge because they have private parties all the time. In one word: disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Loved Opus”
Reviews.Author: Stephen O
Reviews.Content: Just spent the weekend at Opus and had the best time! I was greeted with wine upon check in as well as complimentary valet parking for my stay! Everyone I encountered working there I found exceptionally helpful and kind. The hotel as a whole had a high-end modern feel without being pretentious. The room was very basic/modern but had everything you would need or wantâ€¦ bathroom shower and lighting was quite good! Club KOKO on the first floor was definitely a hot spot, there were lines around the hotel to get in, many have posted that they had issues with noiseâ€¦. I could have hit some luck but I was staying right about the club and had no issue with the noise. This being said I did not come to Montreal to sleepâ€¦. And for those looking for some fun this location is perfectâ€¦ a short walk to most anything you would like to do! I found the overall value and experience was one of the best I have had! A woman named Sabrina was particularly helpful; she assisted us in finding a restaurant, booked the reservation, and drove us there in the car serviceâ€¦ I was floored! I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an amazing boutique hotel experience and would stay in no other hotel on my next trip to Montreal!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loud”
Reviews.Author: mischa3000
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice, it is quite modern and clean. We purchased a Groupon for this location and they were very good about honoring it inspite of previous reviewers having had difficulties with hit. Check-in/out went without a hitch and any questions we had were promptly answered. Their concierge is exceptional, she not only knew the right places to visit and things to do but also ensured we'd get there! That said, the remainder of our experience was below average; most notably the noise. Without a doubt this has to be one of the loudest hotels I have ever stayed at and I have been to a few in my lifetime. It's as if they parked a night club right outside our bedroom, which ironically is pretty close to the truth since their open air bar blasts music until 2-3am. Business travelers stay away! After our visit we needed an item shipped to us that we had left in the room, although we were fortunate enough to have it shipped to us it could not have been more difficult or expensive: 5 phone calls to coordinate house keeping bringing the item to the front desk for shipment, only to be charged $58 Canadian for shipment. I have experienced better.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for certain travellers, pretty but poorly trained staff”
Reviews.Author: TelegramSam55
Reviews.Content: Location: For me, being at the foot of the Plateau gave good access to better restaurants, more interesting shopping, McGill, and "real" Montreal. It's a far walk from the old city and business districts however. The immediate neighborhood isn't inspiring but is clean and safe. The Club: As many, many other reviewers pointed out, the noise from the club is no joke. I called twice to ensure a top-floor room as far as possible from the club and was glad I did. However, when the place closes at 2:00 am, it sounds like a riot is breaking out on all the surrounding streets --screaming, car horns, etc. This woke me up out of a sound sleep two nights in a row, even though the windows were closed. (I'm from New York City so I'm used to urban noise. This was exceptional.) And BTW, whoever characterized this club as "hip" needs to get out more. It feels like a north-of-the-border Jersey Shore outing -- lots of cologne and shiny shirts, drunk girls in prom dresses who can't walk on their high heels and club hits from 5 years ago. Montreal has great nightlife. Not here. The Rooms: Our room was modern, clean, and very comfy. The TV situation is very 90s but that's a small detail. GF approved of the hair drier and shower. Bed was wonderful. The lighting indeed isn't great but not as bad as other reviews make it out to be. The Staff: Good looking, nice, and mostly clueless/useless. When our taxi pulled up, the doorman recognized the driver and they struck up a wonderful-sounding conversation in their own language and we were completely ignored. I took in my own bags and let him catch up with his friend. I'd called twice to ensure a top (5th) floor room and was given one on the third floor. With a little gentle insistence this was taken care of. The next day it rained and there was no umbrella in my room. I asked for one at the front desk and they sent me to the doorman, who sent me back to the front desk. I asked if there was a place nearby I could just buy an umbrella and she had no clue. Finally she checked again and found one but made me promise I'd bring it back. I offered to sign over my first born and she just stared at me. In general, the staff was unfamiliar with the area and unable to suggest even the simplest things, like the closest coffee shop. Did I mention they were good looking? Overall: I'd recommend the Opus to people who don't need to be right next door to tourist areas but want a modern, comfortable base to explore the more authentic parts of the city. If you value sentient, well-trained staff, along with quiet and uninterrupted sleep, stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: biff6506
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel close to the action but not in it this is the place. Nice rooms, clean and the staff is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Sophie B
Reviews.Content: The room is not clean, the air conditionner was not working. There is no mosquito sheet in the window. And they was so match noise during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, A/C not working and not that clean”
Reviews.Author: gennieb
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed here for a night; 5 different rooms. No one had a good night sleep! Noise from bar below, or noise from delivery trucks at 4am, or A/C not working and finally a bed bug bite! All show with absolutely no substance.

Reviews.Title: “Fun time”
Reviews.Author: LiaG08
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience. We stayed at Opus over the weekend.The staff was extremely accommodating and pleasant. The hotel is connected to a club with an outside deck...heat lamps...great music...the best part is taking the elevator back to your hotel room after a fun night out. The location is also great for day time shopping and night life. Overall I came with high expectations and felt that they were met. Also, concierge ladies were extremely helpful with recommendations about site seeing/dining as well as the valet parking attendants.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Noise/Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: mlanton
Reviews.Content: Had a training event at this hotel from Wednesday night through Saturday. Apparently, on Friday and Saturday night, they have a live band. Loud doesn't begin to cover it. I was on the top floor and didn't get to sleep until after 4. The music goes until 3 a.m. Management told us that this is the "personality" of the hotel. They did not mention that this would be the situation to the Event planner arranging the training at the hotel nor did they mention it to those of us who made reservations. They indicated that whoever handled our reservation should have told us about the noise. They did not. No sleep for two nights. No compensation. No customer service whatsoever. Would never recommend this hotel for any reason at any time. Dishes were often dirty -- leftover food. Not worth the money at all.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: caroline f
Reviews.Content: Wow!!! what a great experience!!!!!!! We really enjoy this hotel, the room, the service, the food... everything was just PPERFECT!!! We also meet the great Director of Sales, Yves, who took good care of us. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it can get loud. But it has redeeming qualities, as well.”
Reviews.Author: travelduck80
Reviews.Content: Yes, it can be loud on the weekends, but I also stayed on a weekday and it wasn't at all. When I asked if I could switch to a quieter room after hearing the club the previous night, they said they would switch me if I really wanted but guaranteed me it wouldn't be an issue. I trusted them, and there wasn't a peep from downstairs. Yes, some of the carpet and chairs in the common areas (halls and lobby) are worn and need to be replaced. (A chair in our hall had cigarette burns in it. What do you expect from a younger, clubbing-type clientel?) It is decorated very trendy-like, so if you don't like that, this isn't the place for you. On the other hand, my room was perfect--everything was in perfect condition in the room. I appreciated the comfortable bed, the spacious bathroom and huge soaker tub. I had a leather bench in front of a big bay window. While we were there, they were repainting the walls of the halls on our floor, so maybe they are working on making updates. In addition, the Opus Montreal accepts dogs! This was absolutely fabulous, as not many higher end hotels accept dogs. So I really didn't mind that carpet in the hall was worn. My dog also made the lobby carpet and tile floor wet and muddy (because it rained the entire time we were in Montreal) and the staff didn't bat an eye. It was fine. And I appreciated the fact that they welcomed our fuzzy wet mess of a dog. The breakfast buffet was included in our stay and it was pretty good--had anything I could have thought of. Best of all, different cheeses, fresh fruit, croissants (plain and with Nutella). What can I say? I'm a sucker for brie and buttery pastries. And if you ask me, the location is PERFECT. Between the old port area and the Saint Laurent stip. We walked everywhere--didn't take our car out of the valet parking once. We also walked to Montreal's gay neighborhood (I highly recommend). The neighborhood is not at all sketchy. Yes, on the way to the port area you have to walk through a section of strip clubs and peep shows, but not once did I feel scared. I HIGHLY recommend staying in this area if you decide not to stay at the Opus. The staff was also really helpful in recommending places to go and pointing us in the right direction. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. Also--after reading a review on here about a reservation being lost, I called the day before our stay and confirmed our trip. No problems.

Reviews.Title: “a great stay”
Reviews.Author: TheOtherBond
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many times before but it's been a while, and I was happy to see many familiar friendly faces. I love the modern, stylish decor of the rooms and the restaurant Koko. Staff strike the perfect balance between professional but warm and friendly, and the guys at the front door were always quick to help out and engage in friendly conversation. Montreal is one of my favourite cities, and staying at Opus is a great way to feel part of the action. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Trashy delapidated disaster”
Reviews.Author: Jackie B
Reviews.Content: Booked at Opus with certain expectations of a "4 star" hotel charging $250+/nt.... the cement ceiling, florecent orange walls, Walmart decor, and high crime neighborhood were not amoung them. I'd stayed at the Opus location in Vancouver BC previously as well as having working in the industry for several years, and after checking in was apalled that the Montreal property would advertise being of the same calibur. The 2 girls working at the front desk were polite and helpful, offering to show us some other rooms. After having viewed several we were still unsatisfied and decided to cancel the reservation. I had booked through Expedia and was advised by a customer service agent that Expedia had no issues refunding the 3 days I had booked in full, except that the manager of the hotel had indicated he would only be willing to refund 2. I spoke with him personally about how the room did not meet my expectations for the price. He proceeded to provide various conflicting information about why he wouldn't allow us to leave. He asked what it was I didn't like about the room and took personal offence when I told him the decor and location weren't to our taste. The situation was handled in a very adversarial manner and it took a battle to eventually receive the full refund. On the plus side, we happened across Hotel Chez Swann (much more central location)afterwards and scored an AWESOME boutique room for $50 less per night which included all kinds of cool freebees as well (drinks and appys at an upscale lounge downstairs, etc). Much classier!

Reviews.Title: “Phenominal overall experience!”
Reviews.Author: Kjlclarke
Reviews.Content: Beautiful chic hotel. Wonderful, friendly, professional staff. I would definitely return again and again!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: Cedric G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is worth seing just for its amazing style and design. I stay there very often and always had a great experience. Each room is different and GREAT!!!. Minibar, snacks great modern furniture, Ipod docking, great beds, great dining in their KOKO restaurant, one of the nicest terrace in MTL and much more. Also located in 2 minute walking distance of the best clubs and restaurant Montreal offers. I know I lived in Montreal for many years. So a great experience on business or with family.

Reviews.Title: “A chic, unique home away from home. The perfect blend of comfort and style.”
Reviews.Author: Gloria M
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped inside the OPUS Montreal, we knew we were in for a special stay. The lobby was modern and welcoming and the staff were warm and professional. The room was awesome... especially that sprawling bed and amazing linens. I could LIVE in that bed! We had a great dinner at KOKO downstairs, and when the night club started getting busy, I've never seen so many beautiful people in one place! For those who aren't night hawks, OPUS thoughtfully provided earplugs to ensure a peaceful sleep. I loved the in-room booklet which included a "lifestyle concierge" section with a variety of restaurant and shopping suggestions. It was invaluable for someone like me who was new to the city. Friends who'd stayed at larger hotels nearby came by to visit, and loved the style and energy of the place. They vowed to book the OPUS next visit, which is exactly what I will do.

Reviews.Title: “hip hotel, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: cezinho
Reviews.Content: I was at the OPUS for a long weekend in May with a few friends and really enjoyed my stay. What really stood out what the service. I was constantly asking Emily, Christina and others from the front desk crew for recommendations about restaurants, bars, and other great places to see around the city. They provided me great list of options that fit the vibe I was looking for, as well as alternatives when certain venues were booked/unavailable. They also helped us sort out matters when we got a flat tire on your rental car a day before we were scheduled to leave. The hotel itself is really cool - think of it as a hipper, more local version of a W Hotel. They have a great bar and restaurant that stand on their own and draw big crowds beyond just hotel visitors. Suffice to say that a lot of celebrities and musicians hang out at the OPUS when they're visiting Montreal. I'd highly recommend a stay here if you're looking for a cool experience in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel in vibrant Montreal area”
Reviews.Author: ChefBrandon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights while in town on business and pleasure. The hotel is in a beautiful old building which blends into modern sophistication. My room was very nice, simple and clean but with all the amenities you would expect from a property like this. I used everything in this room from the desk to mini bar and ordered breakfast room service twice which was pre-ordered and came on time every time. The bar restaurant was AMAZING, food was good and well prepared, the room in KOKO is stunning white with black accents. For pleasure I stayed after dinner on Friday night and was blown aware by the atmosphere that the place produced. Lots of beautiful people dancing and having a good time. Definitely will be back, thank you

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: MittenGal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was featured on Groupon. I have always wanted to go to Montreal so I purchased 2 nights and booked a weekend. It is located on a major street. Lots of restaurants and sight seeing within walking distance. Taxis stop frequently in front and a bus stop is within steps so there is no problem getting around. After booking online, I read the reviews so I called and requested an upper room because I read about the noise level. The room was nice-- very modern. Clean, and spacious. Coming back the first night from touring, there was a huge crowd in front trying to get in. We wiggled our way to the front and the doorman let us right in. Once upstairs, yes we could hear the noise, but it was not too bad. After hot showers, and a little TV we were exhausted from all the walking we did. I fell asleep fast and didnt wake up until morning. Breakfast was great! Eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, cereals and lots of fruit. The breakfast was served in the same room that all the dancing took place the night before. The second night the same noise, but again, not a real problem. Hubby did go down there to see what was going on. He said it was room to room people, dancing, mingling, drinking. It seems to be a very popular place. He talked to the door man who said alot of people going to the club will get together and book a room. All in all, the staff was helpful and knowledgeable. The hotel itself is very modern. I would stay again if I ever find myself going back to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “You want boutique you got it!!”
Reviews.Author: Gurj D
Reviews.Content: When travelling to Montreal for business or pleasure my number one choice is always the Opus Montreal. I love where itâ€™s located right, next to Saint-Laurent walking distance so many cafÃ©â€™s, restaurants & great shopping. Thereâ€™s always a great buzz & vibe in the lobby. The staff is always quick to point out where to go & how to get there. If you want to stay in a chic boutique style hotel; Opus Montreal is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “if like pain and suffering, you will love opus.”
Reviews.Author: Thatstroo
Reviews.Content: This hotel could possibly be tolerable for insomniacs, vampires, or those who seek out and/or study masochism.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing on every level”
Reviews.Author: Globalsprinter
Reviews.Content: From start to finish this establishment was sheer disappointment, particularly given that the 'promise' of this hotel is upscale luxury. Upon arrival the doormen were huddled together talking, seemingly unconcerned about an arriving guest with several large bags. The check-in was perhaps the only thing that went well. The hallway to the room had tears in the carpet and many parts were thread bare. Our room was a maintenance disaster. The wood veneer was peeling off the bed headboard, night stands and bureau top. The toilet leaked at it's base for our entire stay inspite of my notes to the maid and front desk. The carpet was in as bad as shape as those in the hallway. Light bulbs were burned out and never replaced. Our complimentary bottled water and coffee was never replenished daily as was supposed to happen, during our 4 night stay, even though we had brought this to staff's attention. Staff seemed disorganized and definitely not up to the promise of the brand. This hotel deserves to go the way of the dodo, just as the General Manager's attention to service and detail obviously has.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star as advertised”
Reviews.Author: RunninAllOver
Reviews.Content: The style of the Hotel was not to our liking. They have tried hard to be "hip & trendy" with decor and paint colours, and are definately trying to appeal to a younger "bar scene" crowd. The location is a bit of a walk to shopping and Old Montreal, not the downtown central location we had hoped for. Carpet in the hallways was wavy and needed replacing. We could definately hear the loud dance bar music from our room on the fourth floor, thank goodness it was a Sunday night and it ended early. All the staff we met were helpful and couteous.

Reviews.Title: “Loud! DAMN Loud!”
Reviews.Author: thollett
Reviews.Content: Is this a hotel or a night club? Pick one, but don't combine the two. Terrible place. Ain't neva goin' back.

Reviews.Title: “Kept up all night by the onsite nightclub”
Reviews.Author: queequeq_jk
Reviews.Content: On the fourth floor. The loudest hotel experience we have ever had. No exaggeration. You are more or less sleeping inside a full volume nightclub. It's 2:15 AM right now. The music and beat are pouring into the room. Outrageous and horrible. One entire side of the hotel is this loud and there are no rooms facing the other direction.

Reviews.Title: “Opus Montreal - a superb hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Myles B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opus Montreal and had a great time exploring all of Montreal. The location of the Opus Hotel is perfect as they are blocks away (walking distance) from some of the finest restaurants, great shopping and all the tourist attractions offered by this historic Canadian City. Affordable rates and a 1st class staff helped to create daily adventures for our kids, my wife and myself (all staff cleanly spoke both English & French). We had no solidified plans when we arrived in Montreal, but we quickly realized the staffs in-depth knowledge of Montreal was invaluable - we look very forward to our return. We highly recommend staying at the Opus Hotel in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, brutal service”
Reviews.Author: Wilcoh
Reviews.Content: Great location and funky hotel but from moment checked in the service was terrible. First time visit and upon check in no review of hotel amenities. Is there a fitness room? Restaurant? How about just simple directions to elevator? Have stayed at 3 star hotels with better check in from front desk staff. Came back from work and headed to outdoor bar for a drink and sat for about 10 minutes on one of the comfortable couches. Well could have curled up and called it a night before I got service. Headed inside to the bar and ordered a glass of wine. Brought it outside to a couch closer to the bar and still had a hard time flagging one of the 3 bar staff for a refill. I was one of 4 groups outside and only about 2 tables inside. Is this the norm for chic hotels in Montreal? Have stayed at plenty and they at least have basic service down. Worth staying for a comfortable stay but only if your priority is to not be bothered with.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a fun weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Rainmax
Reviews.Content: We got a large suite at this hotel and proceeded to have a really great time in Montreal and at the hotel. The nightclub is great and the restaurant is good too. The staff is really what sets this place apart -- the concierge service and valet service at this place is fantastic! They know how to treat guests and I recommend for a fun weekend place in Montreal! I would not stay here on the weekend if I wanted a quite place, but if you want a fun place, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but noisy”
Reviews.Author: KnowAboutTravel
Reviews.Content: Spent a night after a friend suggested the hotel. Rooms were small but stylish. there's a nightclub on the ground floor that seemed to go on until the early hours with some dance music blaring. Lots of young people but not for an old guy like me. Would be a great hotel if you're in your twenties.Certainly not for families.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel but not the best for a downtown business trip”
Reviews.Author: ScottBeach
Reviews.Content: I responded to a Sniqueaway special rate for the Opus Hotel in Montreal for the week after the Gran Prix. I get to Montreal quite a bit and stay at the Marriott or the Omni for work travel. When I saw the deal, I thought I would give the hotel a try. The lobby is very chic and the outdoor lounge is nice and was quite popular after work. The room was a deep purple and had a very modern, contemporary "W" feel. The bed was comfortable and the space was great. My complaint: The complimentary BMW X5 car service is in my opinion a total sham. On three separate occasions I inquired about getting a ride (to dinner, to a meeting, etc) since this hotel was quite far from my office. Each time the SUV was parked out front but no one was available to drive it. Mind you, this was at 6 PM or 8 AM, prime times for needing a shuttle. Based on my experience, I can't tell you if the vehicle has a driver or an engine for that matter. As a result, I took a cab once and walked 25 mins in a suit twice. Good hotel but I can't see paying more than the Omni or Marriott for this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great mini getaway”
Reviews.Author: gurlly16
Reviews.Content: Booked Opus Montreal as a Just For Laughs package so we got a great deal on the room. We stayed from July 29- 31. Check In & Out: Our room was not ready until shortly after 3pm but check in was quick and easy as was check out, no issues. Rooms: The bed and pillows are wonderful and I slept like a baby. Our room was on the 4th floor and there was no loud noise from the club below. We requested a room on the quiet side. We had an issue with the A/C but had someone up instantly to fix. Location: FANTASTIC!!! Walking distance to St. Catherine Street, St. Laurent , Cresecnt, and St. Arthur so you have no shortage of great shops, patios and resturants to choose from. We ate great food all weekend and of course enjoyed the number of places offering happy hour. KOKO: Located in Opus is a very trendy place and if you stay at teh hotel you have access to it right from the hotel no line up. People line up outside to get in. Upon entering you can order bottle service and around $180.00 a bottle or you can go drink by drink for $10.00 a pop. Live DJ, great atmosphere but very pricey. We stayed for a drink and then decided to tour and hit up a few pubs and patio's. Nightlife: Lot's to see and do within walking distance to the hotel. The streets get packed bumper to bumper with cars in the evenings so it is best to walk. It's busy till the wee hours in the morning and during the day traffic isn't nearly as busy. Overall this was a nice getaway. I loved the location of the hotel, the staff were great and the rooms are nice. The breakfast that came with our package was a continetial with a hot station that had bacon, eggs and sausages, along with bagels, cheeses, fruit and fresh juices. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “"The Most Popular Bar In Town" In Your Hotel Room - Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: RealWisam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is aesthetically pleasing but I would never stay here again nor would I ever recommend it to anyone. In fact, I strongly recommend that you stay elsewhere. My Dad was speaking to a member of the front desk staff and he boasted that their night club is one of the most popular in all of Montreal. Great for them (?) but this is at the expense of their hotel guests. The majority of the rooms in this low-rise hotel sit directly above and around their ridiculously loud night club. It is honestly one of the most horrible stays I've ever had, which is especially disappointing considering the potential of the hotel. Reading very similar bad reviews from numerous other people, it astounds me that the hotel chooses the success of their night club at the expense of their hotel guests. Is this not primarily a hotel? How well can the night club be doing that they jeopardize the hotel experience? It's mind boggling. I read the reviews before arriving (after we had already booked) and like many of you (I assume) hoped that I would be the lucky one who would not be affected by the noise. How wrong I was! I'm sitting in the lobby typing this review and there has already been two other groups who have demanded a room change, not including us. When my Dad asked the front desk staff for a room change, they told him that, unfortunately, they didn't have any other rooms with two beds (family trip) on the other side of the hotel. They said they did have a room on a higher floor but that it wouldn't make a difference. Last night at 12:30AM, after tossing and turning for an hour due to the incredible noise, I was forced to walk to a nearby pharmacy to get ear plugs. Even with the ear plugs cutting most of the noise, you could still feel the incredibly loud bass pumping through the hotel. I'm sitting here writing this review and DREADING having to stay another two nights. UGH. This has put such a damper on the trip. Honestly, for $200/night, I'd rather sleep in a park at this point. It's actually unbearable. Why do people stay here despite the countless reviews imploring you not to? Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Boutique Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Beachman727
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on business probably 10 times but haven't gotten around to reviewing it. Opus is our hotel of choice in Montreal since it's pretty hip and in a good location, and generally delivers very good value on the room rate. You are a short walk to Ste Catherine and right at the bottom of the Saint Laurent restaurants and club row. You are however a bit of a hike to Old Montreal but if it's summer you can walk easily or a short cab ride around $10. The Opus is a NYC style kind of minimalist dark kind of vibe everywhere with sealed concrete ceilings, black tile showers etc. The rooms are pretty dark even with the lighting available. The carpet is starting to look a bit worn in both the rooms and the hallways but it's not at the point yet where it detracts from the overall vibe. This is not a super quiet hotel given they have a very cool lobby bar/restaurant and outdoor courtyard that is frequently used to events and a nightclub. It's never really been an issue for me to sleep and not every time i've been there has there been some large noisy event downstairs but if you are the person that needs absolute quiet and any kind of noise is going to bother you - this is not the place for you. I'd suggest the W or Sofitel. There is a continental breakfast which is usually included in our room rate which is pretty good - bagels, yogurt, juice, fruit etc. The restaurant/bar is all black and white with designer furnishings and booths. My favourite is the horse lamp - there is a full sized horse that has a lampshade on it - look for it. An alternative to this would be something in Old Montreal where there are also some boutique hotels but definitely not the same NYC vibe and not close to the Saint Laurent restaurant scene - and likely much higher room rate than Opus.

Reviews.Title: “Nightclub in your room!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wineysuzie
Reviews.Content: We stayed Friday through Sunday, the hotel has an outdoor nightclub which is on the courtyard below the rooms. The music blares until 3 am. We ales to move to the other Side of the building but were told they were full. They put a cheap set of foam earplugs on each side of the bed which is supposed to suffice. Other than the concierge who was so helpful, the rest of the staff are aloof and unhelpful. Gym is good an uncrowded. You can do way better for what they charge,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Modern, great service, location, dog friendly, hot nightclub.”
Reviews.Author: DBobbins
Reviews.Content: Emily, the front desk supervisor, was very helpful in recommending and getting us reservations at some of the best restaurants in the city. All other staff were courteous and helpful as well. Robin, Oshawa, On

Reviews.Title: “It was like the nightclub was inside my room”
Reviews.Author: gbt14
Reviews.Content: The Opus Hotel is sleek and modern, and the staff is pleasant. The major problem when I stayed there last Saturday night was that the nightclub was right outside our window and the music didn't stop until almost 4 AM. It was impossible to sleep. When I complained, the staff person said that the loud music was "part of our brand." If you like to party late, stay here. Otherwise, find someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rubin6
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to St Laurent and St Denis streets with shopping, clubs, restaurants. Within walking distance from Jazz festival, cultural area, McGill University. Close to Metro. Can park car for length of stay and walk or use Metro. Very friendly and helpful staff. Check in and check out are a breeze. Coffee machine in room with selection of free coffee and tea. Free wireless internet is an added bonus. Valet parking available with in-out privileges. Enjoyed stay and will most definitely return to the Opus.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel tragedy. Bring proof of your reservation.”
Reviews.Author: Steven_in_Amherst
Reviews.Content: I wonder how many other customers they do this to. The hotel overbooks its rooms, then tells arriving guests that their reservation was actually for the day before. Guests who did not have the foresight to bring a copy of their reservation are SOL, problem solved for the hotel. Well that is what Opus Hotel in Montreal did. Keep in mind that this is supposed to be a four star hotel and the per night room rate is in the mid-triple digits. Our reservation was for two days. When we first arrived at the hotel, it was clear that it had been oversold. They needed to bump someone and, instead of just being honest, they lied and said the reservation had been made for the day before. Every hotel was full so, had I not brought a copy of the reservation, we would have had to sleep in the car. In hindsight, that might have been preferable. Eventually they put us in a 90 degree room with no air conditioning, right next to a noisy street. The next day we returned to the hotel at 11 p.m. hoping to change rooms. The valet and hotel staff were nowhere to be found. There was literally no one at the front desk. We waited for fifteen minutes before anyone showed up. Customer service being non-existent, we considered pulling the fire alarm to see if that would improve matters. Reporting this to front desk supervisor Emily the next morning, she seemed to think this was the level of customer service to be expected of this hotel (i.e. none). Very disappointed. I would pretty much rather sleep in my car than be forced to stay in Opus hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “@&*! nightmare”
Reviews.Author: sallyjones1954
Reviews.Content: UNREAL - it's 3 AM, I'm on the 4th floor, and it's so loud I can't hear myself think - a stinking band is blasting "music" and hundreds of people are yelling at the tops of their lungs right below me in restaurant Koko. My vacation is ruined. I'm paying more than $200/night and would be better off sleeping on the sidewalk.

Reviews.Title: “groovy friendly”
Reviews.Author: bassermann
Reviews.Content: I love this place and eating and shopping on St Laurent is easy... the breakfast rocks and the people that work there are cool and smile. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “A huge disappointment in service !”
Reviews.Author: BoutiqueLover34
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations for our stay in April but was completely let down by the service. When booking I was told not to worry about the pet fee... at check in I was told it would be $50 dollar for our 2 night stay and at check out I was charged twice for this. At check in I asked if their was availability to upgrade our room as we were celebrating {I was happy to pay more for a better room }... I was instantly told "No, there was nothing" I asked again politely as I was really hoping to treat my husband to a nice weekend... she at least checked the computer this time for a moment and said no again. I believe she thought I was looking for a complimentary upgrade which was not the case. We gave up and settled into our room to discover we were in a Standard and not the Deluxe room I had booked and receive a confirmation for... so if there were no other rooms available what happened to the room I booked? Not once was a rude or difficult , I did not want to taint my husbands birthday so I said nothing further. When I got home I wrote a letter with my feedback. I am in the industry and thought my feedback would be welcomed as coaching and training is always ongoing in the customer service business. After phone tag for sometime the manager got a hold of me to tell me that " we always get compliments about our service" and that " his staff had all been there for 5 or more years" not once did he apologize for my terrible experience or convey any compassion about the mistakes that were made by his team. He was rather defensive even though I was agreeing that the hotel has a good reputation I was simply not one of the guests who experienced it. Too bad really I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we will be back !!”
Reviews.Author: ssalem
Reviews.Content: we really enjoyed our stay at opus montreal, the staff were amazing, the location is funky, the restaurant / lounge is fantastic, great ambiance and decor, rooms are trendy and spacious! all together it is was a great experience, we will definitely go back :)

Reviews.Title: “... sometimes, things can get better!”
Reviews.Author: MerihMarzari
Reviews.Content: ... I discoverd the Opus thanks to a Customer who is in love with this Hotel. l cancelled my previous reservation in another hotel and moved in the Opus. First impression was not very positive since I am normally staying in Business Hotels and my expectations were very high since I was told: "it's the best hotel in Montreal". To make a long story short, this is really a great hotel for people who love DESIGN, MUSIC and good FOOD. I must be honest, as I checked out, I was sorry that my stay was short: took advantage of the great Fitness Center with excellent equipment, Business Center with lovely Macs, the Restaurant where I had a great steak listening to a live DJ and of the Club in the hotel that makes this Hotel special. Staff in my opinion is a bit strange but some are absolutely fantastic and made my stay 5 and for sure I will be coming here every time I will be again in Monteral. I strongly suggest this hotel to young couples and trendy Business travellers: this hotel is very HIP !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but too nosy”
Reviews.Author: dsrfield
Reviews.Content: The acomodations were well appointed and the service was good. but the club noise was very loud.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: lucybears
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Opus for a number of days while in Montreal. It was beautiful, terrifically located, particularly for the convention centre as well as great areas for shopping, eating and drinking. The rooms were bright and comfortable and the staff eager to help.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel, but the noise won't bring me back”
Reviews.Author: neuroriz
Reviews.Content: The service is great, the location is awesome--walking distance to shopping and night life (but not old Montreal), and the rooms are beautifully decorated. BUT!!!! There is a reason there are earplugs left by the bed. There is a club downstairs, so on the weekend expect it to sound like there is a dj playing in your room till about 3am. If you stumble back to your room tipsy and tired before 3am don't expect to sleep. It's reallllllly loud!!! Likely not an issue if you are staying during the week, but I won't return to this hotel for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - shame about the noise!!!”
Reviews.Author: cyargo
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel with great location but totally ruined by the noise of the clubs downstairs. Wish I had read previous reviews warning about the noise. I am 30 years old and the noise from the clubs kept us awake until 3.30 AM. No warning from the check-in staff about the rooms either. Very disappointing. Unbelievable that other reviews do not mention the noise - it is unavoidable.

Reviews.Title: “Denis is the man!!”
Reviews.Author: mp0187
Reviews.Content: I went to OPUS Montreal with a couple friends for a buddies bachelar party weekend. "IT WAS AWESOME!!!" The location was great.. right downtown and walking distance to the cool shique St. Laraunt. It was nice enough of a day where we walked a the way to Old Montreal.. definitely to check out. The staff was friendly and the guys at the front always opened the door for us each time we went out. Small detail, but trust me, in my profession it goes a long way. We got service rides from the staff in a luxry BMW X5 to a restaurant and they even came back to pick us up when we were done. And to the cute gal who was serving us a continental breakfast, even though it taste like cardboard cause toxic bodies couldn't stomach it, we still had good laughs chatting with her. But the man of the weekend who made it all happen was my main man "DENIS". His greeting and hospitality from the time we checked in to the time we checked out definitely made the weekend. A solid stand up dude.. and for that we thank you my friend! Overall, it was a blast. Would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: shaner1301
Reviews.Content: Amazing service from Jaque Lapierre. Treated like royalty and will def return for service alone

Reviews.Title: “As always, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Muppykisses
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Opus Vancouver and Montreal on multiple occasions and always look forward to doing so. The rooms are spacious, modern, and comfortable, and the staff gracious and accommodating. Though the room service menu is not extensive, everything ordered was delicious and delivered quickly. Loved the salmon caesar salad, and the great selection of scotch (Lagavulin in particular!) Had an issue with the in-room high speed internet not working, and it was fixed quickly by the MANAGER!!!!! He personally came to check on it when maintenance person did not know how to repair. Also of note, the valet remembered us from a visit in 2008. These little touches are what keep us coming back again and again! Only downside I can think of no WiFi in rooms yet, though apparently it is coming soon.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: fabioladee
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say that i very much enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Its a beautiful place with great decor and inviting staff. The staff at this hotel are there whenever you need them from needing a ban aid or a ride to a restaurant that was a bit far away. Also the room are awesome and the bathroom was so nice. So all that to say i enjoyed my stay at the Opus Hotel i would recommended 100%. ps: the pillows and the bed were so nice that i didn't want to get out of the bed in the morning (afternoon).

Reviews.Title: “Modern luxury with conveniences and fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: citysee
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at Opus. I loved the decor and the staff was friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. I needed technical help with my computer ; assistance was provided immediately and competently. A great night's sleep was had and fresh coffee was available either in my room via Keurig machine or lobby. St. Laurent Street is one block away filled with great restaurants and ambience. I used the fitness room each day as it contained good equipment and a light inviting atmosphere. I so enjoyed my stay at Opus. I will definitely return and make it my hotel of choice in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely recommend it to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: vivchin
Reviews.Content: I recently organized a four day meeting for about 30 people at the Opus Hotel in Montreal and was very impressed with the venue but even more pleased with the staff. The hotel itself is very well located near restaurants and shops, with very funky and attractive decor. The rooms themselves are lovely with comfortable beds and nice bathrooms. The only suggestions I would make are (a) there be brighter lighting and more light fixtures (almost all the participants felt the rooms were too dark) (b) that the hotel put up some sheers or light curtains on the windows behind the heavy blinds/curtains- if you close the curtains, it's too dark and if you leave them open, the neighbouring buildings look right into your room so there is a need for sheers, and (c) new carpets - the carpets in some parts of the hotel were looking a bit tired and grubby. These are just suggestions for the owner to make it perfect! The meeting rooms were really great - well lit and attractive spaces. I loved the Koko Restaurant and Suco Lounge, which by day are lovely bright and airy breakfast and lunch rooms, and by night very funky night clubs. I loved how they changed our seating arrangements for every meal - made it very interesting and we never knew what to expect. The food was really wonderful and beautifully presented. Even sandwiches were made to look like edible art, lots of it and very tasty. Nothing was too difficult and the staff were very obliging, attentive, accommodating and friendly. My first contact was the Sales Manager, Yves - he was very quick to respond to queries, attentive to our needs, cooperative, and extremely welcoming. Emilie, Sabrina and Maryam were fantastic on the rooming lists and catering, always responding promptly and adjusting to last minute changes without hesitation. Moy, the Maitre d'Hotel with whom I liaised daily on food and room arrangements, was so incredibly good at what he does, efficient, always polite, quick to repond and always with a warm smile. Everyone worked happily; I didn't hear one word of complaint nor did I see one look of irritation from anyone. Without exception all our participants loved the hotel and said everything was fantastic [except for the small issue of the dark rooms!]. This is a uniquely well run hotel with everyone working as a team. I would certainly go back without hesitation and would certainly recommend it to anyone whether on holiday or business.

Reviews.Title: “Best service in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: apouliot
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the hotel. Rooms are decorated whit style, service was so great (staf +++), the gym is not the biggest I've ever seen but it plenty does the job. The location is very practice; juste on the entrance of the city, near subways, park your car at the hotel and go enjoy the town! We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay when in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: relyt69
Reviews.Content: Wow!..what can we say..what a gem of a hotel in the heart of Montreal. We stayed there sat. March 12th. We were running late from a flat tire for a spa appt...the moment we showed up to the door Opus staff took care of everything. They emptied our luggage from our car, checked us in rapidly and took our luggage to our room. And what a room! spacious, well decorated, and great view of the city. The hotel is steps from a multitude of restaurants and nightlife. A quick cab ride can take you to old Montreal.
