Opus also boasts an exquisite restaurant/bar on location that will make you a yummy drink after a long day of shopping downtown. All our future stays will definitly be spent at the Opus. Thank you Patrick and your staff for our wonderful stay. T.R.

Reviews.Title: “quality has dropped”
Reviews.Author: mk761
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel a total of 3 times. my first two stays were great, the last not so much and i doubt i will be back. my last stay was over the new year and we went to koko on the ground floor for the new year's eve celebration, which was a good time. however our hotel room was directly over the restaurant and if we weren't drunk, we would not have been able to sleep that night. you can hear music and feel vibrations in the room. a day or two later, there was some huge private party at koko and again the noise and shaking was insane. in my previous stays, my rooms were up on higher floors where there were no noise issues, so my biggest tip is request a higher floor. on the mornings after the parties, there was some garbage and cigarette butts in the hallways, and loads of cigarette butts and other garbage outside the hotel. i'm a smoker too, but this was ridiculous -- they have no one to sweep?? the rooms are very clean but housekeeping simply never showed up to our room on one of the days. we also seemed to be always out of towels, which was never an issue before. the free coffee station in the lobby was not always well maintained -- sometimes they'd be out of coffee and other times you'd see used coffee cups and sugar packets that should've been cleared off. other cons: they really need to add lighting to the rooms (putting on makeup can be difficult) and it's time to replace some of the furniture -- hotel doesn't have that new feel anymore. the pros: the front desk staff are very nice and super helpful. they are young (mid 20s to mid 30s) and in the know about where to go eat/drink/party (they know their tourist attractions too). koko is still a cool, fun spot with pretty good food and very nice staff. location is very good -- away from tourist stops (still close by metro), but walking distance to restaurants, shopping and nightlife. pricing is usually quite good for a 4 star. i like the l'occitane toiletries. other tips: parking at the hotel is pricey but we were convinced to use it because the lot a block away is quite sketchy and will try to rip you off, and there were some concerns over street parking (safety; strange regulations). don't get breakfast at the hotel. there are some great spots with better food and pricing just a short walk away. you can ask front desk for tips.

Reviews.Title: “OPUS has it all!!”
Reviews.Author: NickyB39
Reviews.Content: I visited Montreal for the first time in my adult life at the beginning of February with a couple of friends. We decided to stay at The Opus Hotel. This was probably the best decision we could've made considering what our trip was all about. Opus had it all!! Centrally located on Sherbrooke Ouest we couldn't have been in a better spot. Daytime activities were footsteps away and the night scene was in our lobby! No joke! KoKo is one of the hottest night scenes in the city and it is off the lobby at The Opus. This made the trip home a quick elevator ride. The staff is amazing, from the doorman to the bartenders to the cleaning staff. Everyone made you feel at home. I would definitely recommend Opus to my friends and family. Next time I visit Montreal I'll be staying at Opus hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Lost us as regular customers.”
Reviews.Author: pagogo
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Hotel Opus on 6 previous occasions and loved it. Had one incident about noise but it was resolved easily. I am 50 - not a club kid- but do not have a problem with club kids or minimal noise. Booked their winter promotion from the Opus website - upon arrival we asked for a quiet room facing Clark ST. but was given the choice of a room facing Sherbrooke which was noisy and opted for another - the other room faced ST. Laurent and was above their club on the first level. I was assured that noise would not be a problem as there was no event that evening which we discovered was untrue at 1 AM when booming music was rattling the window and club does not close until 3.15AM. Called front desk for another room - was told nothing was available but I would get a rebate for the room. Did not want a rebate on a room that was impossible to sleep in soundwise. Only received another room when I went to the lobby to use my laptop to book another hotel for the same night and told them I was checking out as I had a business meeting later that morning. What do you know - they had other rooms available!!! These same rooms were available when I checked in but were not available to us!! In other words, the worst rooms are given for their own "Winter promotion" - you are informed that there is no refund when booking the room. The hotel clearly knows which rooms are unsuitable soundwise for most hotel guests when their clubs are open on weekends. I realize that money is to be made from their clubs and they are marketing for a younger crowd. We received excellent service in the past from the staff but the staff person that checked us into the hotel was not truthful. Unless you sleep like a stone or under 30 - you might want to avoid Hotel Opus.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfectly fits my needs!”
Reviews.Author: jdriemel
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel because of its proximity to my company's head office but even if it weren't so convenient, I would still recommend it. The service is exceptional, the staff are so friendly and helpful that they are always a pleasure to deal with. My young daughter loves when I return home after a stay at the Opus because I bring her the sweet treats that are left on my turned down bed each evening! My only complaint about the rooms are that they are very dark due to the room decor and lighting.

Reviews.Title: “Only Gets Better!”
Reviews.Author: GuiltyPleasures08
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to this hotel in 2 years. Seeing as i have been here with my wife the first time and my colleagues the second, i was kinda looking forward to discovering what kind of stay i would have as a solo traveller. Being recongnized by the valets offered a very welcoming feel. I opted for a junior suite this time and it did not dissapoint. It had a nice big glass wall and was fairly large. This time around i had to go to the casino and see the city from a tourists point of view. Being able to have the hotel as my home base i could be near everything important and have a short cab ride to any of places i wanted to visit (Olympic stadium, Basilica...) It was a delightful surprise to see the Koko restaurant had a new menu, couldnt beleive it was even better then before! I never leave this hotel dissapointed, it will be my home away from home as long as i have a reason to visit Montreal!!

Reviews.Title: “Sexy and Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Emmangt
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome modern room and the food at the restaurant was amazing. Great service. They even brought our desserts to the room from the restaurant because we wanted to enjoy it in the privacy of our room! Excellent quality and it's so cheap for what you get!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bonez23
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Opus from Dec 27-29. From the time we arrived to the time we left I found the hotel to be absolutely phenomenal. The rooms are great condition and are very spacious. My only complaint is that currently the rooms do not have wireless internet which is painful, however they do offer free wireless in the lobby. The concierge provided us with a great restaurant recommendation for dinner one night and set us up with the premier Montreal Bagel place one morning. Everyday we were greeted with a smile from every staff member at the property. Definitely would stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Awesome Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: sziel09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opus Montreal for one night at the beginning of December. The front desk manager, Alexie Deschenes, helped us make our decision to go with the Junior Suite. The room was absolutely beautiful, clean and the beds were very comfortable! She also suggested we go to Koko for dinner which was a great choice. The food was delicious and the staff were very attentive. Overall we had a great experience and felt like celebrities staying at this wonderful hotel. We will definitely be staying there again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Dark and Noisy, but comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: Payster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend in December 2010. When we checked in we went to a room that was painted "home depot orange". Not a peaceful colour to come home to at the end of a winter day walking around Montreal. The lighting in the rooms is pretty bleak, when it's dark outside, overcast, you could not turn on enough lights to make the room feel bright. After not sleeping for 2 nights above their club, (open until 3:30 am - vibrating noise all the way up to our room, and we were on the 4th floor), we requested to be moved to another room away from the club side and they accommodated. We were given a room on the 3rd floor which was painted a very nice taupe (more calming), but still hard to get the room lit up, but the sounds from the club were not there. On a good note, the hotel is in a great location for getting around and the beds were very comfy. Otherwise, I am sure I could find a similar priced hotel in a good area that was just as good, without a club on the first floor and had better lighting. If you do go, and don't sleep soundly, request a room away from the club.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you do not value sleep”
Reviews.Author: bpash2020
Reviews.Content: OK. First off I am not a complainer. When I have an ailment I go to work. When a body part hurts I never see a Dr. and when a hotel or business is not the best I rarely speak up. However I am writing this review for all my fellow business travelers that expect when they stay at a hotel they can get a good night sleep and be well rested for a very important meeting that they flew many hours across two countries to attend. The time is now 12:15am and when I called down to the desk to ask when the disco music that is reverberating through my room and I am sure many others guest rooms is going to end. The answer is at 1am. I could tell from the front desk's reactiion that they get these complaints all the time. this is not an isolated incident. Mind you this is a Thursday night not a Friday or Sat (not that that would be any better) I am all for having a good time and partying however I am paying a pretty penny for what is an attractive room in an attractive hotel in a nice part of town and I have 0% chance of trying to fall asleep until the party music is over at 1am. ARE YOU KIDDING?? As a business traveler that clocks easily 50 nights a year on the road and who always looks to stay at 4 or 5 star hotels I am very surprised that this establishment is opting to take the extra money for a private party over the care and well being of their guests. In another hour when the music hopefully ends and I can hopefully get the Joan Jett I love rock and roll song out of my head perhaps I will feel differently but for now unless you are in Montreal to party all night I would look to avoid this hotel. You've been warned.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: 2010Imagine
Reviews.Content: From a the outside this hotel is very nice. An Art-deco-like. The loby, the Koko restaurant are very nice. You expect the best becauce you are located in the heart of Montreal's best!!! But all changes... Once you get in touch with the staff, it's another story. At the front desk, no "hello'' has if we were disturbing everybody. We waiting a good 30 minutes for someone to get our luguages. But, the cherry on top was the room. OMG!!! It looked like a party that had gone bad. The kind of room were paint was missing on the walls and on the bed frame, scratches everywhere. You could see traces of the hands and fingers on the headboard. We had guest in another room and they lifted the mattresse and they found blood stains on their sheets .The rooms are pitiful. Finally, this hotel sucks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay but glad I didn't need to get up early”
Reviews.Author: Stylus
Reviews.Content: The Opus has a great location outside the "tourist core" and I'm very glad I spent a few days here during my Montreal stay. Preferring independent stores to "high street retail" I thought this area had the best shopping in the city. The rooms are attractive and the service was very good. If you are enjoying the Montreal nightlife there is a restaurant downstairs which becomes a hip nightclub during the evening (the downside is that it is noisy - if you have an early morning ask for a room on the other side of the hotel). My one suggestion to management would be to include free wifi throughout the hotel, not just in the public areas. Given the hotel's branding we were surprised to find that it was not offering this service. High speed internet was offered in rooms but with a fee. Overall I would stay again. There is a beautiful patio which I imagine must be lovely in the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisinOttawa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Opus over the Thanksgiving weekend to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday. We travel a lot for business and pleasure and were looking forward to this boutique hotel, having heard great things about the Vancouver location. What a disappointment! We checked in to find holes in the bathroom walls where someone had ripped out the towel rack. This was just the start - the bathroom sink was clogged with matted hair, the paint in the bathroom was chipped and the whole room felt tired. When we called down, fixes were promised and not delivered, etc. The next day, room service cleaned the room but didn't restock - we came back after shopping to find no glasses, mugs, coffee and only a few towels. After numerous calls, things were more or less in order, though I was particularly shocked to have one of the cleaning people tell me that she wouldn't bring more wine glasses (there had been some when we checked in), because they were downstairs and too far away. Being Thanksgiving weekend in Montreal, we didn't want to face the hassle of finding somewhere new, so we stayed. The next day took the cake - they cleaned the room, but forgot to restock the toilet paper!

Reviews.Title: “Opus kills it in Monteal. Game over.”
Reviews.Author: randallgraham
Reviews.Content: Montreal is an amazing city. And the Opus Hotel Montreal is the ideal base of operations. Funky fresh but aficionado appointed rooms. Killer room service (get the cheese burger). And a snap fast friendly service make it my favourite place to stay. If only there was one in every major city. Would I recommend to my friends, tour managers, recording stars, clients? Fu#k yes.

Reviews.Title: “Opus - Fantasy Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: samantharobinson
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time on our trip to Montreal staying at the beautiful Opus Hotel. Unfortunately spending just one night in our room, we were overwhelmed by the size and grandeur of our suite. The impecable attention to detail and design made us feel like we were in a movie star suite, down to the lollipop that was left when they turned down our bed. Special thanks to Alexie Deschenes for giving us a beautiful array of suites to choose from, and for helping us pick the PERFECT one for us. Will definitely revisit!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE AND AMAZING EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: DANIAROSE
Reviews.Content: We had a marvelous stay at the OPUS hotel Montreal. Wonderful interiors, very good service especially from Denis who went above and beyond the call of duty to make sure we were taken care of. We must recommend the hotel's resto lounge Suco. Very reasonably priced too for a luxury hotel. We had a great and memorable time we will definitely come back and make this an annual affair and recommend it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “swanky hotel but made me feel old at times”
Reviews.Author: traveltdot
Reviews.Content: Sept 2009 a friday night to monday morning We stayed here for a weekend getaway with another couple. The hotel is very nice. Rooms were big and open, nice comfy bed and great shower and bathroom. A continental breakfast was included and set up in the lobby every morning. I think there was free wi fi downstairs too. Small gym but well equipped. We didn't do any meals at the restaurant but we did do cocktails at KoKo. Everything seemed in lined with the rest of the hotel. They did their version of a New York boutique style hotel. The game changer was on Saturday night. There is a club in the basement and you can hear the music through the entire place. We actually went into the club on Saturday just to see and have a drink. Be prepared for everyone to be 25 and under and loud club music throughout. It is impossible to talk. We did it just for fun. Our group ranges from mid 30-late 40s so we had a laugh looking at the young folks mingle in ridiculous outfits. After feeling like we were too old we went back to our rooms and I noticed that young folks were going in and out of rooms throughout the evening. It reminded me of my graduation night when me and a group of friends pooled together some money to stay overnight at a hotel. Someone probably begged their parent to charge the room to the card and all of their friends just piled in for the evening. So it was a little noisier than we would have liked on Saturday but it eventually died down. We also had a room outside of the elevator so we kept hearing the door open and close. The good thing is that the hotel was quiet again on Sunday night. Location of the hotel is great if you plan on clubbing and dining on St Laurent. But I think I'll be staying in Old Montreal next time. Old Montreal has some of the nicer restaurants and shops. Next time I will walk or take a short cab ride down to st laurent and but I like a nice quiet sleep and I didn't get that on Saturday in this neighbourhood. And just like the club at the hotel, the entire strip of St Laurent is club central. The restaurants all turn into discos after 10pm. So if you don't like noise or young silly people stay somewhere else. But if you do this is the place for you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect & full off refreshing energy and luxury”
Reviews.Author: Travelpuck
Reviews.Content: Despite heaving read the mixed comments concerning it, Iâ€™ve booked the Opus Montreal over my last Week End stay in Montreal. I know the cities hotel fauna very well, as I come business &leisurewise several times per year. The Hotel is simply flawless, astonishing, refreshing, young and creative! Rooms are perfectly designed, spacious if not to say voluptuous. A perfect mix between classical 4 star hotel features and high-end design / equipment. Everything, but really everything is taken care of, as youâ€™ll find it normally only within classical palace hotels. The Guest Relation team is at your permanent disposal, so you may indulge yourself in the hotels features, or any other place in Montreal. Their ludique and creative Concierge system is unique! Indeed the team is refreshingly young, and thus knows the cities tendencies and whereabouts perfectly. The Opus is so well situated that you can do all downtown by foot. Restaurant & Lounge is indeed one of the cities best, which makes you kinda smile concerning all the comments about noise. Yes, there is ambiance in the Lobby and on their outside terrace in the evenings, and even a really trendy one. I had absolutely no noise issue in my standard room, and didnâ€™t hear any of the other clients complaining either. The architecture is awesome between on of MontrÃ©alâ€™s oldest buildings, combined to the new, perfectly designed parts. A real Hip Hotel with outstanding features & service. Veit

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: beachloafer
Reviews.Content: While the hotel was nice overall, and in a great location, there were for sure some problems with it. First, upon check-in, the staff refused to give us the free breakfast that was clearly offered if you booked on the website. Second, there is a night club on the ground floor, and if you're staying during a season when people can go outside to the patio which is in a courtyard that the hotel surrounds upward (even for a smoke break), you can hear every drunken screaming conversation and dance music until after 3am. When we got to our room, I was wondering what the ear plugs were for...Also, there was a fire alarm around that time, which people outside were saying had happened before during their stay (don't know whether it's party-goers pulling it). Overall, then, I loved the location, but wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply an Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: GuiltyPleasures08
Reviews.Content: From the second we stepped in we wanted to experience everything montreal had to offer. My 2 colleagues had never been to montreal and i wanted them to relive my first trip here. The concierge sent us to the best restaurants whether it be for our formal dinners or late night snacks at the local grease boxes. Although it can get loud, it is to be expected with the prime location, absolutly anything we needed was within a few minutes walking distance. We were located on the top floor so noise was not an issue for us, we thoroughly enjoyed our time at the bar and restaurant, definitly a local hotspot on Saturdays. We had a small issue with our television but the Manager Denis came to fix it himself within minutes of us calling the front desk. the Valets Raphael and Brian were very accomodating with every question we had as well, the drop off Service was A++ Seeing as we were out of the room mostly on business or enjoying the final days of summer in the city the ambient lighting was not an issue for us, although understandable how some would prefer a little more. Overall a great experience and i will definitly be back if i have my way!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Place in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: adventure2010_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is excellent. We did not have a car. We pretty much walked to all the places recommended by the concierge. Everyone that works at the Opus is exceptionally friendly, kind and helpful. Special mention goes to Tony Leung, Matthew, Dennis and Fritz. You do not need a travel guide. Just ask the concierge. The rooms have really bright colors like purple and orange and apple green! We stayed on the top floor so noise was not an issue. Rooms are spacious and beds are really comfortable. Ask Tony about the best Chinese restaurant in town. Tony and Fritz exceeded our expectation by driving us to the train station! Now that is SERVICE!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, noisy and rude.”
Reviews.Author: Naddy1234
Reviews.Content: Beware! This LOOKS like a classy, sweet little boutique hotel as the advertisements boast, but this place will disappoint anyone looking for a quiet and well-maintained hotel. I got a room at a lower rate than usual (maybe a slower time?) but then I also noticed that suddenly things weren't available to me, like the free continental breakfast that everyone else seemed to have or a room switch. I stayed in Room 417; dark and dingy. The sheets were clean but the carpeting is absolutely worn out, the furniture doors are falling apart so cupboards wouldn't close properly, the inside of the mini bar was filthy with spilled juice. Perhaps they thought none of this would be noticed since they keep the rooms very dark - the lighting is ridiculously dim and the walls a dark, bordello red. Whenever I called down to reception, they were so busy they would never answer. One woman at reception was irritated when I cam down to tell her that the room was too dark. I was wearing jeans and when she realized that I had a "king" room (whatever that means,) she said, "oh I thought you were in a budget room." ?????? How rude. And even though she made a show of looking for another room for me and even though the hotel was empty, as they kept telling me, there was no other room to switch to. Such liars. When I needed my car for the evening from the "valet only" parking situation here (and don't even think about retrieving anything from your car once they take it to park -- "not done",) the valet took 25 minutes to get my car out! After an exhausting evening of waiting for my car, waiting for reception, waiting to be connected to room service (that took 5 different phone calls!,) I thought I would have a peaceful night's sleep. But at 2:30 AM, young men were running up and down the hallway screaming as only drunk people do at the top of their lungs banging on each other's doors!! Now I realized why I needed the earplugs that were supplied by the bedside; for the unruly guests that have left the deafening night club downstairs. This is not a well run hotel and while some of the staff were nice, most were indignant, pompous and rude. The hotel lobby furniture, while trendy looking from afar, is tired and dirty as is the furniture in the rooms and in the restaurant. Don't waste your money or time with this place. It's clearly for the entitled young and unruly crowd who don't know any better.

Reviews.Title: “Family-friendly and trendy in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: Victoriatravels3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Opus Montreal for five nights and we were very comfortable. There is a young, positive energy about the place. Locals clearly enjoy the restaurant and bar (a good sign). The staff do their best to accommodate any requests. The location is perfect for driving or walking in several directions. And the lobby and property, particularly the terrace, are welcoming. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller12345678123
Reviews.Content: The Opus is an elegant hotel with very clean and spacious rooms, in a very central location. Close to everything, restaurants, shopping and nightlife. The staff was helpful and very friendly. Overall it we had a very pleasant stay. Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ryguy22x
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I have stayed here twice and they never seem to disappoint. During the summer months, or warm months anyway, the club gets packed. I even ran up to my room while it was bumping and had no disturbance in my room. The restaurant is tasty and trendy. Decent continental breakfast is included in your stay. Great location. St. Laurent has tons of attractions - bars, rest's, boutique shops. Overall great stay...

Reviews.Title: “really pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: martinbarmash
Reviews.Content: spent 3 days at the hotel and was impressed with the quality of serviceand the rooms . Had room service and received great dinner in 20 minutes exactly as we ordered.my only criticism is that without ceiling lights the the room is missing lamps to be more comfortable but the facilities especially the beds were outstanding. id recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a wonderful boutique style hotel in a great location

Reviews.Title: “Was apprehensive after other reviews, but stay turned out just fine”
Reviews.Author: elfy10
Reviews.Content: I went to Montreal for a business trip and stayed two nights, from Thursday to Saturday. I have to say I was a little worried about the noise and general feel of the place after reading the reviews, but in my case, everything went smoothly and I have no complaints. I booked my room online and found it ready for me when I checked in early evening. Yes, the rooms are painted in a dark color and there's no ceiling lights, but since I need almost total darkness to sleep, this was a good thing for me. Bed is very comfy, and even the smallest room is fairly large. The door is separated from the rest of the room by the bathroom area, which limits the hallway noise. From Friday to Saturday, I heard some music and people talking below, yes, but the earplugs did the trick. Since I travelled by bus, I appreciated the subway station a few minutes down St-Laurent and the Tim Hortons'-gas station in front for snacks. St-Laurent north of Sherbrooke has some of the greatest place to go eat (though I didn't have time to go). On the negative side, Internet service is expensive, and so was breakfast (in fact, pretty much everything is an "extra"). Staff was as pleasant as could be, but maybe I just got lucky. Valets were always around to call/hail a taxi. All in all, no major complaints, and I would stay there again, just not *every* time I'm in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay for me and my wife.”
Reviews.Author: Globe101
Reviews.Content: This is the first review i write so i will try and be as precise as possible. My wife booked this hotel and at first i was very reluctant from reading the reviews but it came strongly recomeneded from her friends who stayed there before. We arrived at 2am and i was expecting check in to take long but they prepared it in advance for us so within 3 minutes we had our keys and were on our way. The room was tasfully decorated and it was what i expected from a boutique hotel. It was of good size and the beds were really comfy. The next day we went out and i realised how perfectly located it was, close to all the museums and shopping. We stayed for three nights and everything went well. The staff was always curtious and polite and the room was always cleaned. I had a little trouble figuring out the T.v and AC but once they sent someone to explain it to me it was a breeze. Hope this help...

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION, BEAUTIFUL HOTEL AND AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: vincentlaroche
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to every traveler coming to Montreal. I have been to this hotel twice before moving to Montreal myself and I have been entirely satisfied. The hotel is very well located, near all major attractions of the city (Old Montreal, Downtown). Cleanliness, Service, Noise Level were A1. Price range is also very reasonable for the quality of the hotel. The restaurant of the hotel (Koko) is also incredibly good, the food is high quality and the design is very modern and impressive. Do not even hesitate to make it your home for your next trip to Montreal

Reviews.Title: “No worth it”
Reviews.Author: Ottawa_gal_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by someone so we booked an overnighter. Should have read the other reviews before and that would have changed my mind. I would have canceled it but it was one of the pre-paid deals. Anywho, we got to the hotel around 11:30 am and the room wasn't ready. Fair enough since we were there early. The reception clerk told us the room on the 5th was reserved for us since we wanted something quiet (club below so it gets loud) but it wasn't ready. The room was vacant and should be cleaned soon. They kept our bags while we did some walking around in old Montreal (nice but nothing like Quebec City). We came back at 3:00 and a new reception clerk checked us in. When he gave me our keys, it said room 417. I proceeded to tell them what happened that morning and he said the room on the 5th wasn't ready because the guest has checked out very late (wasn't what we were told that morning). The room on the 4th would have been fine but the whole lying thing bothered me. So we get to the room on the 4th and there's a plate with an envelope addressed to someone else (clearly our room was meant for someone else). Went back to the reception and were told that it was our room but they'd come and remove the plate. Someone came to get the plate and I got them to bring us a new ice bucket since the one in the room was filled with water and hair. Disgusting. The room was ok. Nicely decorated but very dark. The bed was very comfortable. They have the TV on with a welcoming message...too bad they got my first and last name wrong...even after I corrected them at reception. My issues with the room: dirty carpet, 2 lights burned. door to bathroom sticks (glad I was there since my hubby was locked in and door could only be opened from the outside), cobwebs, knob in shower broken and furniture not in good order (damaged, doors to closet won't close). This hotel is fairly new yet the upkeep is horrible. Bottom line...not one major issue just a lot of different little things that would make me choose a different hotel. I would not recommend this hotel if you are looking for a nice quiet getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was in a mid-range adult film....”
Reviews.Author: WorldClassSleeper
Reviews.Content: Why I think the Opus is a perfect place to film a porn; - The room I stayed in was tacky - everything in it looked cheap. It was like I was at an Umbra clearance sale....example, gold vases, velvet top-down curtains, pleather ottoman, metal lamps, etc. This is so you remember your special night. - The room was dark, because there wasn't a ceiling light, the lamps and small wall fixtures didn't do the job. Helps if your date is ugly. - There's a giant mirror on the wall in front of the bed. Like the large full length mirror beside the washroom wasn't enough, but makes it easy to watch yourself....if you're in to that. - Techno music from the nightclub outside your window is loud. You can also hear the air conditioner, and the people partying below. This helps a lot if your date is talking too much or if you're starting to feel tired and want to sleep. - The glass shower has a build in seat just in case your partner wants to watch you use the toilet or wash themselves. - You won't be disturbed. The staff won't even come if you ask them to. They'll just slip your bill under the door on your last day. - Donâ€™t worry about anyone uploading your video on to the internet, because the internet outlet in the room doesnâ€™t work. - I'm sure the TV has lots of adult channels because it sits on a large metal box and it's so confusing children, and even grown adults cannot navigate it without accidentally ordering hotel merchandise and services.

Reviews.Title: “If you are wanting to relive university life... but on a better budget...”
Reviews.Author: devsadvtrav
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well situated, the staff are friendly. But on the weekend it is a nightclub that happens to have rooms upstairs... the club is outdoors and beneath the hotel room windows so the noise carries to the rooms, and continues until the club closes at 3 am. They know it is an issue as each guest is provided with ear plus, The hotel was full of 20 somethings ready to party, and without enough imagination to go to a true Montreal club. In the morning the halls smelled of booze and pictures in the hallway had been pulled off the walls. The first night we were out until after the club closed, so the noise wasn't an issue, but the second night... we weren't so lucky. Avoid if you want to sleep before 3:30 am!!! Avoid if you are not wanting to relive keg parties.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: kathrynboyd0
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Opus Montreal in June and have no complaints. The hotel was clean, modern, and very comfertable. The staff was friendly, it was easy to check in and check out and overall it was a great experience. The restaurant has great food and the service was good. I never waited for my food or drinks. The hotel seemed really posh but it didn't come off as prententious, just classy. I don't really have any complaints about my stay. I stayed there for 3 nights and was in the perfect location for shopping on St Denis and St Catherines. The Jazz festival was close and so were a lot of great restaurants. The only thing I wish was some recommendations for restaurants in the area - I kind of wandered around looking for one, and there was many, just didn't know which were good. Maybe that info was available but I didn't see it in the room. All in all I would recommed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel even better staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrdandiego
Reviews.Content: I was recently on a business trip in Montreal and I have to say I was very impressed with the staff and hotel. The manager at the front desk went way beyond my expectations... giving me information on everything going on during my stay in Montreal. I've been around the globe and visited many large chains and this one holds it own. Very modern looking hotel and rooms. I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “One stop entertainment in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: portmano
Reviews.Content: We arrived at an ungodly 07:30am after a red eye flight from Vancouver and were greeted by the doorman. The front desk checked us in quickly and luckily our room was ready for a couple of hours of shuteye. The room was eclectic and comfortable with a king bed, separate washroom closet and good size bathroom with frameless walk-in shower and separate tub. Opus is walking distance to some great shopping, entertainment and restaurants and old Montreal is a quick 'Bixi' bike ride or even quicker cab ride. Back to entertainment; both Koko (the restaurant at Opus) and Suco (the bar downstairs) make staying at Opus a one stop shop for an extremely entertaining weekend. If you're looking for a well priced boutique hotel for a weekend of fun, Opus Montreal is a must stay.

Reviews.Title: “style confort and service”
Reviews.Author: 182166Globetrotter
Reviews.Content: My stay at Opus was relaxing and pleasing. As soon as you walk to the front desk the comfortable feeling of being taken care of sets in. The fast room service and valet's make for a minimum of snags when you need to be someplace a.s.a.p . All in all the opus is a great choice for whatever reason you are staying.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!! Great Staff!! Excellent Service!!”
Reviews.Author: FalMTL
Reviews.Content: If you're interested in a great stay in the trendiest area in MTL stay at Opus! In addition to be perfectly situated the vibe is great. From the friendly valets, the helpful front desk staff, and to great service at KOKO (the hottest terrasse in MTL) this hotel is truly a great place to stay, and hang out in the city! The food is delish (strongly recommend the sushi) and the extensive drink list, you will definately find something to your liking. The rooms are modern, beds are comfortable, the shower pressure is excellent, and the club sandwich from room service is amazing! Im sure you will enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: travellingpants4
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a waste of money. Hotel staff were unfriendly and rude. Our room was not available at the time of check-in (3PM) and we waited until 4:10 in the lobby. At the time they told us we were being moved into a larger room because the one I reserved was not available - this would have been fine if they hadn't tried to charge me more than double what I reserved at when I tried to check out. It took some discussion to have them remove the extra charges, even though I had my copy of the room reservation (and the price) with me. The room itself was quite nice but it was incredibly loud. The music from downstairs club was blaring until about 3AM and the street noise was unbearable. In fairness, the hotel does provide earplugs (and the location is excellent) but it seems like some better windows and sound-deadening might be needed. The in-room satellite or cable signal was terrible and made most channels unwatchable. All in all, it was far too expensive for the quality and certainly for the service. Location and bathrooms were lovely, all else was just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, would do it again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: dc2010
Reviews.Content: honestly can't say enough about Montreal, it is a great play be. The people are friendly the resto nightlife is amazing. Then it comes down to where to stay?? Location locations location. This is so important in your overall outcome. The opus was GREAT for all of it! It was central the rooms are elegant and comfortable and there is a very cool bar in the lobby. I would 100% stay here again and again. Trust me i travel for a living this is the hot spot!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel - ditto”
Reviews.Author: Perks_10
Reviews.Content: I tried 3 rooms in the hotel. All were filthy, loud and too hot. Each room was too hot and was between 28-30. The front desk always seemed inconvenienced and disinterested. The work desk was insufficient. No room for laptop and no real work surface. The music was blasting in all rooms until 4am. You will not sleep guaranteed. No matter which room they transfer you to. Carpets throughout the hotel are stained and dirty. Room service was impossible to get and when they did answer they were over 30 minutes late than when they said they would there. The front desk wouldn't allow me to check out because it was "too early". Refused to give me a receipt. I almost missed my plane. They would not let me take the taxi waiting outside. They insisted that I use "their taxi service. An argument ensued between the taxi driver and the front desk. Unacceptable and inappropriate. Stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Safea
Reviews.Content: I spent almost a week in Montreal and stayed at the Opus. The hotel is perfectly located- kitty-corner to Rue St. Laurent and in walking distance to other hip streets with great shops and restaurants, down the street from McGill Univeristy and museums, in walking distance to Chinatown (St. Catherine, the next street over), the business district (since the Opus is technically downtown), Vieux Port (Old Montreal), and close to the metro (subway system). Each member of the staff was very helpful and pleasant, attending to whatever I needed. The decor was a lovely minimalist modern, with clean bathroom and sleeping area. There is secure, underground parking here as well (for about $26/day+some small fees). The bathroom was even filled with L'Occitane products! I could not have been happier with the room, service, and location for the price. The hotel even had small computers for customer use in the lobby (free, with internet access). The only drawbacks to this hotel was that the room needs more/brighter lights, the window does not latch & lock (but i was on the 3rd floor- no possible way someone could've climbed in), and there was an incessant white noise in the room (sounding as if someone was taking a shower-- air cleaning system, perhaps?). I will DEFINITELY stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: JAPvascular
Reviews.Content: Fabulous rooms and staff. Easy walk to restaurants. Only draw back, you had to go to the lobby to get wireless. Will go back on vacation with husband. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but very dark room”
Reviews.Author: jackster57
Reviews.Content: We found the Opus to be clean and comfortable, but our room was extremely dark. It was hard to see what was in our suitcases in the evenings even with all the meager lights on. Couldn't read or do anything in the room at night except watch TV. However, location was central and service was friendly and good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: anissag
Reviews.Content: Right in the Heart of the city! Close to all major nightlife and shopping areas!. Great rooms! Service is amazing! The restaurant / Club is hot! Food is delicious and is a great place to hang out on the weekends for a party! One of the best places to stay in Montreal

Reviews.Title: “Opus is a hotel that brings a platinum level experience through an amazing customer experience from arrival to departure”
Reviews.Author: annabaird
Reviews.Content: The Opus Hotels are in top 3 the best hotels I have ever stayed in worldwide. They are both luxurious and cutting edge while maintaining comfort and individuality. At the Opus Montreal, the location is perfect distance to all the major Montreal destinations. The hotel ammenities are 5-star and the staff are unbelievably accomodating and professional. I was truly impressed with the caliber of the hotel and would advise anyone to make it their only choice for accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: WallpaperToronto
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say the Opus Hotel, Montreal was the most wonderful hotel experience I've had in years. We spent 3 nights there and did not want to leave. We were there for the New Years week and got to know some of the staff...AMAZING people. The location is beyond perfect, giving you easy access to the heart of downtown Montreal. The rooms are stunning, and the bed - to die for...so comfortable. The Koko Restaurant is beautiful and the food is yummy. I recommend this hotel to anybody and everybody who is considering a trip to Montreal... it's an experience you won't soon forget.

Reviews.Title: “New Years 2010 at OPUS was fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: alexgardner
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked a few nights at Opus around New Years and we couldn't have been happier with the experience. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating and made us both feel like welcomed guests. The room was stylish, chic, and unpretentious. Our king size bed was so comfy it was difficult to get out of bed. The weather report that was left on our bed each night was a nice touch. We rang in the New Year at Koko (the hotel restaurant) and they put on a great party. What more can I say other than check it out for yourselves, you won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, nice hotel in great area of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: ALV11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was trendy but had very good service. The rooms were nice, very confortable beds and bathrooms. Within walking distance to restaurants and bars. The hotel restaurant was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious”
Reviews.Author: ninayging
Reviews.Content: The hotel room has very modern furnishings that it is bordering on being uncomfortable. The lighting in the room is insufficient unless you prefer your rooms to be in the barely-lit category. There is one "desk chair" that is as comfortable as a molded plastic chair and the "comfy chair" doesn't have much padding on it either. We had coffee on the 2 days that we were there and they replenished the coffee without replenishing the sugar. I don't know if it was missed but since the containers were side by side you would think that they would replenish that when they did the coffee. Thank goodness I take my coffee black because they don't provide creamer either. The hotel is bordered on one side by a street that is inhabited by drunks and substance abusers. Be careful when walking on Rue St-Laurent because people will accost you for change and there are men who urinate on the sides of the buildings so be careful of those wet puddles, they might not be water. I will recommend this hotel only if you like rooms that have gray concrete ceilings, dark brown furniture, dark blue walls, dark gray carpet, brown window shades and low lighting. I'm glad the bedding was white or I would have never found the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hot Spot with exceptional service at a down to earth price”
Reviews.Author: jpgbu1
Reviews.Content: Perfect location withing walking distance of Saint Catherine for shopping, Notre Dame for Old Montreal, Cresent for Dining, Saint Laurent for night life, This hotel Has it all! Great restaraunt, club inside, and service to boot. Everyone was friendly and cutious. It wa also a Aniversary for my wife and I and the upon entering our room, the turn down service had left a bottle of Champaign. We Will be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “think twice!”
Reviews.Author: cebuanaflorida
Reviews.Content: I have never written a negative review for a hotel, this is my first. Hotel room is too dark, I guess they were trying to go with their modern style of decor. Although I like how the bathroom is set up, however it doesnt have enough space/hooks/bars to hang or put your things on, again this could be due to their decor style. After a long day of travel or sightseeing, you want to be in a room that is comfortable and cozy. Opus Montreal is not. Also, location is not recommended if you are just a tourist. One good point: free wifi access at the lobby

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service stylish cool chic comfortable friendly great location”
Reviews.Author: markCooperstone
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Opus was fantastic. I had high expectations for service style and comfort and I am happy to say that all expectations were surpassed. The location is in walking distance of all that is a must see in Montreal. You don't have to walk to far though for an amazing dining out experience as the hotels restaurant and cocktail lounge "KOKO'S" offers an exciting culinary experience and serves up some real tasty and unique beverages. Certainly the place to see and be seen..very cool!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds - too bad I couldn't sleep”
Reviews.Author: zembic
Reviews.Content: I wish I had read some of these reviews before deciding to stay at the Opus Hotel in Montreal. The hotel itself was very nice, comfortable, and the valet staff was great. However, the nightclub kept us awake until 3am with the thumping, and the front desk gave me directions that had me driving down a one way street the wrong way. Needless to say, I would NEVER stay at this hotel again, which is too bad because it has such great potential.

Reviews.Title: “The valet damaged the transmission in my car.”
Reviews.Author: mattias8
Reviews.Content: Nothing too remarkable about the hotel itself. It's on St-Laurent so if that's near where you plan to go out the location is nice. Room rates are far above average for Montreal so it is no bargain, especially if you consider the hidden risks. On check-in they gave me the wrong type of room. The front desk fixed the problem by bringing up keys to the correct type of room but mumbled something about it somehow being my fault. I don't understand the purpose of their comment. What difference does it make? It was no problem at all until they made a fuss. Room was fine but construction noise started early in the morning (08:30) in the courtyard. After checking out the valet brought my car around and we drove off. I realized pretty quickly that the valet had done serious damage to my transmission. I had no reverse gear. This was a problem that could have been easily solved if the hotel covered the modest cost of the repair but instead they quite obviously (and quite embarrassingly! Poor front line staff!) avoided my calls for 2 weeks until I gave up. I guess they must be running out of money.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit and Opus does it again! Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: showmanNewYork
Reviews.Content: We just had to return to this hotel during our recent tour on the East side of N. America. Everything is well thought out. It's a great place for young and "in" travelers or anyone that appreciates a contemporary hotel. Great restaurant called Koko with beautiful decor. Great staff all well dressed and groomed. Top 3 most comfortable beds I have ever slept in! Just keep in mind that this is a place that is known for it's nightlife... there will be noise. Embrace it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and experience!”
Reviews.Author: BrendaStephens
Reviews.Content: We had such a positive experience with all the staff at the Opus. We were a comedy of errors as we had messed up our reservation on line and then our car broke down. Every one was extremely helpful as we were "Chaos". We loved the Koko's restaurant on Saturday night - incredible food and attention to detail. My husband and I brought our bikes and loved all the extensive bike routes through the city. Coming from a different time zone - we were able to sleep in and not hear any noise from other rooms or in the halls. The bed is comfortable and the room is stylish and functional - very European. The area hosts excellent restaurants -all in walking distance. We totally enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Passe chic, average value and at boundary of stylish neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: mich_star_collector
Reviews.Content: An average chic hotel, designed by the same mindless people as those who built similar style hotels in Taipei, Paris, Hong Kong, Bangkok, etc. Lack of lighting, dark walls and floors, noisy ventilation, leaking glass shower stalls, funky accessories from Pier 1... except this one is very spacious and bright.

Reviews.Title: “Vapid like Paris Hilton (not the hotel - the personality)”
Reviews.Author: dshawger1
Reviews.Content: If Style is important to you and substance is not - than this is your hotel. We stayed at this hotel during the Montreal Jazz Festival. The location is great - and the hotel looks great. What is missing is the ability to sleep. There is a THUMPING NIGHT CLUB right below you. We asked for a room far enough away so that we would not hear the club - they put us on the 4th floor. It did not work. The ear plugs they provide do not help - the bed, floor and room vibrate. People were talking loudly from 3-5am - and even were screaming at some points during the night. I told the front desk in the morning that it was one of the worst nights sleep that I ever had - and the response was (oh Yeah the night club is pretty loud on weekends)... not even a "we are sorry". I said that I was going to write a scathing review on TripAdvisor and other webpages - and I just got awful stares - with no words at all. What a disappointment and complete waste of money. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pkalpesh
Reviews.Content: I travel to montreal about once a mth for the last 20 years, staying in hotels for the last 8. I would have to say of all the hotels in the city I have stayed at, the OPUS ranks up there. The valets were EXCELLENT, the atmosphere was trendy, and the front desk very helpful. Located in the heart of St Laurent St, the was a quick walk and ride to many places. The room rates were respectable, and to top it off, when you turn on the TV it has your name on the screen! Rooms were clean, quite and very nice, whom ever said there was a noise issue, or room service was always knocking when you didnt ask them were wrong, I had my DO NOT DISTURB sign, and wasnt disturbed till about 3pm, and i politly asked front desk that i am out of the room, may i get service,and boom by 4pm when i was back, room was clean, and they even found my partners earings from the night before. HIGHLY recomend this hotel, small, trendy, good looking patrons, and being 28, just the right atmosphere for me!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: VanCityGuys
Reviews.Content: Great staff, ideal location, and perfect vibe. Having lived in Montreal, it is amazing to stay in a hotel, be able to walk out the front door and be minutes (walk, metro or taxi) from "all that's happening" in the city. The staff recommended great places, Koko was a blast and the rooms (we stayed twice..) were very comfortable, one with a courtyard view, the other with a stunning city view. Special requests (more ice, glasses, towels, re-booting the TV/internet which I broke, extra umbrella and a hotel car ride to the train station, etc) were accomodated exceedingly well. Even the fitness room was a pleasant surprise (we typically find hotel gyms useless - this one worked for us) We'll be back - and would not stay elsewhere in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at.”
Reviews.Author: linkyMontreal
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful, hotel was very cozy and comfortable and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Opus is my favorite hotel in Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: NoelFox
Reviews.Content: The Opus Hotel is the perfect place to say if you are traveling to Montreal. It has wonderful rooms, a great restaurant, friendly staff and is very lively for those of you who are looking for something to do after dinner. Not to mention it's great location in relation to all of the best shops, restaurants and culture in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location!”
Reviews.Author: simplicity03
Reviews.Content: Pros: We stayed for an entire week in July in a Privilege King room. From reading other reviews, we requested a room on the 5th floor and had absolutely NO problem with noise/vibrations from the bar. The service for our room was great. Our bed was made daily, the radio was turned on to a classical station to welcome us whenever we arrived at night, all bathroom products were promptly replaced even before they were half-done and the "refill boy" came by a number of times to ask if our coffee machine needed refills. Even if we left with the Do Not Disturb sign on, the cleaning lady always made sure to ask us if we needed extra towels, etc. when we ran into her. The front desk was also very helpful, and it seemed that there was always someone opening the front door regardless of the time of night (or morning) we came in. By far the greatest PRO would be the great location: On St. Laurent with the trendiest restaurants and boutiques; a walk away from St. Catherine and Crescent Street for shopping and more restaurants; a metro station a couple of blocks down. Overall, everything I wanted to see/do was close to Opus and we rarely took a taxi or public transportation. Cons: The only complaint I have about the room was that it was TOO DARK during the night, with no ceiling lights since their ceilings are made of concrete. Even with two lamps, two bedside table lamps, and a mirror light on, the room was very dark, making it hard to get ready, put on makeup, etc. In retrospect, I am almost certain if I asked for another tall lamp they would have provided it. Also, don't order the breakfast from the hotel. It is extremely overpriced! A simple breakfast with juice will cost one person $22. However, if you walk north of Sherbrooke on St. Laurent you will find a restaurant called Cafeteria that will serve more than what Opus offers for less than $9. To me, Koko was also overpriced; you are paying for the ambience and not the amount of food on your plate. The service was not exceptional here either; expo brought out our food assuming our appetizer plates had been cleared (since they sat empty for 20 minutes) and we also waited a long time for our refills. Go there for drinks - not for dinner. Despite these cons, I would 100% stay at Opus again. The service was exceptional and the location was great! If you are interested in coming when the Jazz Festival or Just for Laughs is on , this is a prime location.

Reviews.Title: “SPECTACULAR - EXCITING - ROMANTIC - COZY - AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: QuebecBlondie
Reviews.Content: As guests at the OPUS HOTEL MONTREAL in May 2009, for a very special occasion, we both felt very welcome and given all the attention a King & Queen expect plus more. We felt totally relaxed and comfortable. We want to thank both management and staff for a wonderful and memorable stay. Until our next visit Doreen & Louis Schlomowitz

Reviews.Title: “Awesome summer getaway”
Reviews.Author: marc921
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located off St Laurent Blvd which is packed with Montreal's top restaurants & nightclubs. We literally walked out the door and into the heart of the action. It would highly recommend the Opus Hotel in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience”
Reviews.Author: MangiareBenissimo
Reviews.Content: The Opus Montreal was truly a refreshing change from the large hotel chains I stay at for business. From the time the cab drops one odf, the experience begins- One enters this inviting interesting lobby, one is greeted with a welcoming smile at receptions. the room are faulous and have a modern yet relaxing feels about them. Suko is a very social bar. Dinner at KOKO is a must-fabulous food and fabulous decor-WOW if you are in a quandry as to where to go for dinner just ask Patrick-his recommendations were all great-Thanks! All in all a fantastic experience WE WILL BE BACK

Reviews.Title: “All show--don't go”
Reviews.Author: ackbladder
Reviews.Content: Like many other reviewers, we too were kept awake until the wee hours by an entirely unacceptable level of noise. Functions until 3am, then people talking loudly in the halls until 5--beyond the pale. We got the "Oh, didn't they tell you" runaround when we talked to the front desk the first morning after, and got parking and room service comped, but that hardly makes up for the one, primary, non-negotiable service a hotel must provide: a good night's sleep! Service was so-so outside of that. Room service was unimpressive. The price for room was fair; other prices less so. Overall, had the impression of what a hotel run by Apple computer (or Steve Jobs) would be like: pretty to look at, entirely (and overly) trendy, but short on delivery. If you must go, be SURE you are not on the side of the hotel facing the bar/function courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “48 hours without any sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Nola70119
Reviews.Content: Every room on our side of the hotel was over their night club, which had events both Saturday and Sunday night that lasted until after 3 a.m. in the morning. The ear plugs next to the bed did nothing to help with the fact that the room was vibrating. It was truly horrendous. The hotel itself is very nice, but for the price I'd expect to be able to get some sleep. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location from all the attractions.”
Reviews.Author: mtlindiantraveller
Reviews.Content: We recently had a guys weekend in Montreal and stayed at the Opus hotel. This was a perfect locale / setting for the weekend. The hotel itself is located at sherbrooke and stlaurent, which are the two prime streets in montreal, intersecting - Within a short walk in any direction is incredible nightlife, restaurants and shopping. The hotel has a sleek, chic boutique feel with very friendly, non-pretentious staff. The rooms are very tastefully decorated. On the main floor with special access for guests is Koko restaurant which turns into a very happening nightspot post dinner. I travel frequently within the US and Canada and it definitely is one of the better hotels i have stayed in (south beach chill feel with a subtle new york coolness to it).

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ashley_in_TO
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room, lots of desk space, nice bathroom arrangement. Noise wasn't an issue, but likely because we were there on a Sunday night. The restaurant/bar is certainly set up for loud, swank nights. Restaurant for dinner was very good, the quality lived up to the price. Continental breakfast buffet was not bad. All staff were helpful and pleasant. WiFi in lobby was iffy; didn't purchase WiFi in room. Hotel is right across from Just for Laughs venue.

Reviews.Title: “Noise Level is Unacceptable: Higher End Hotel with Low End experience”
Reviews.Author: WitsEndOttawa
Reviews.Content: I too made the mistake of not checking this site before booking the hotel. To be sure, the public areas are very nice and we found the staff courteous and helpful. The restaurant attached to the hotel was excellent. But the noise from the bar was awful. We were placed in the room right over the bar. The furniture rumbled, the lights shook and the decibel level was so loud, the ear plugs were useless. (Honestly, ear plugs....at a high end hotel?) The staff are well aware of the problem but we were not advised before we booked the room. I complained and asked to be moved. We were told that the hotel was full and this was not possible. The supervisor offered a 50 percent discount for the room. I declined saying that 50 a percent discount for half a night's sleep was unacceptable. We received a full refund. To my mind, the compensation we received was a bare minimum. A hotel that is unable to guarantee conditions that support sleep, shouldn't be in business as a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend Stay!”
Reviews.Author: bostontravelguys
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Opus is a true gem! I rank it as one of the top hotels that I've ever visited. The staff and their level of service were remarkable, making the stay even more enjoyable. Koko, the restaurant at the hotel, is a must when you visit - the food there was delicious! I will definitel stay at Opus again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great Choice!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdami
Reviews.Content: From the moment we got there we LOVED it! Katherine was very helpful with the reservation (including dinner reservations at Koko), Ralph the bellboy and valet guy was just great.... We didn't want to leave.... Rooms are amazing, Koko was delicious and trendy. This is the RIGHT WAY to experience Montreal! We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Opus Montreal was great”
Reviews.Author: SCNB
Reviews.Content: This hotel felt very trendy/funky without being pretentious. The rooms were really big, and the beds were so comfortable, it was hard to get up in the morning. The turn down service left green tea chocolates...pretty cool.Definitely felt like you were part of the action; the restaurant downstairs always seemed to be busy, and became a late-night hot spot for locals.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Everything”
Reviews.Author: deanguest
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Opus for one nite in September and was impressed from the moment I pulled up to the curb. The Valet took my baggage and keys right away and led me into the reception area to check in. They were incredibly professional and very welcoming to the hotel. Once I got to my room - I actually had to snap a couple of pictures to send to my wife right away as I wished that she could have joined me on the trip. It was amazing!!! Then I proceeded down to Koko for drinks and dinner later that afternoon and was even more impressed by the surrounding, great service and amazing food and cocktails. All in all - I would say that staying at this hotel is a must if you are going to Montreal on business or pleasure - I cant wait for my next trip to be scheduled. Thank you to everyone at Opus!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty on the outside....”
Reviews.Author: hothearted
Reviews.Content: Very pretty to look at, I actually really loved the decor. Pinks and blacks. When I arrived well after check in almost 5pm my room wasn't ready. Front desk informed me the shower in my room was being repaired and it would be ready shortly. I was in fabulous mood and decided to wander around the neighbourhood. Upon returning front desk apologized. After checking in and setting up my laptop I noticed my internet was not complimentary as was promised by the entertainment sales manager. I called the front desk and they took care of the problem promptly. A few minutes later there was a knock at door. I was expecting an apology favour (considering what a high profile boutique hotel the opus is) only to have my door opened by two engineers apologizing as they didn't know the room was occupied. Then a few minutes later a woman from housekeeping opens my door (no knock what so ever) sees me and without an apology or any explanation shuts the door. How unorganized was this place! It blew my mind. Aren't we in the year 2008? I thought this chic boutique hotel would of at least had some sort of system to notify two different staff members that a room was occupied. From that second forward I felt the need to put my double dead bolt on. Unreal. Sunday breakfast was dead in their restaurant. Our server was lovely and it was so sad to see the place empty. Over all this hotel is slick and very pretty but not worth the price for the lack of organization I experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Party On!”
Reviews.Author: Lvermont
Reviews.Content: We give this hotel three stars because as a hotel it is great, but it really depends upon what you are looking for. If you want a great place to party hop from, this is it! In seconds you are in one of the hippest bar scenes in Montreal, including an '80s club with people dancing on the bar, and several others that I am way to old for (I'm 38). For a rockin' getaway with very little sleep, this is great. My husband and I did not get in until 3:30 am either night. The first night we slept soundly-- no noise (Friday). Then NEXT night, there was a full-fledged party on our floor because of the wedding party staying in the hotel. Well, you can imagine that we wanted to sleep. Oh well, we couldn't, despite the ear plugs that are given out as a hospitality! To cut down on the noise I suggest you ask for a room that is not above the bar or which opens up over the swank open-air bar in the hotel's lower level.

Reviews.Title: “way too loud!”
Reviews.Author: jessie12
Reviews.Content: now i have to confess i didnt look at this website before booking this hotel - big mistake. we had a room on the first floor facing the inner courtyard aka the outside bar area. i cant believe people are stupid enough to stay at this hotel - they must have been like me and not read any reviews. it was so [--] loud - esp sat night when the weather was good and the bar in full swing. on the sat night, after having an admitedly quite tasty and reasonably priced cocktail at said bar we went to our room at 11pm, tried to watch a movie which still couldnt drown out the noise from the bar. it reminded me of staying in miami beach. in actual fact we were so exhausted every night we actually feel asleep - with the earplugs in of course. its a great area for shopping - but would never stay here again, unless perhaps in the winter when the outside bar area will be covered in snow and hence no music. the room was quite nice, very "cool" with chocolates every night and l'occtaine bath products, but the lighting was bad.

Reviews.Title: “Real Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: carniv
Reviews.Content: Having had a friendly telephone conversation with a member of the reservations staff to book my stay, I was looking forward to my first visit to Opus. The hotel's location is convenient to explore the city but the building is situated on a busy cross-roads with constant traffic heard throughout the building. The first suite I was shown to did not have a bath as requested and I was moved to a small standard room overlooking the courtyard. Luckily it was a Monday, the receptionist did not recommend rooms overlooking the courtyard from Thursday to Sunday due to the late night party in the bar below. I stayed in the room for 3 nights before moving to a suite with a bath which I had originally booked. The room was spacious but painted a lurid orange and overlooked a side street littered with refuse. The room was badly lit and had no privacy from onlookers. A majority of the staff were very unfriendly and two receptionists in particular were extremely inefficient in carrying out simple guest requests. The highlight of this hotel were the porters / bell boys who always had a smile of their faces, nothing was to much trouble for them. Shame about the others. A real disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Rock and Roll Hotel... You will NOT sleep.”
Reviews.Author: juliea344
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Hotwire for a very low rate, otherwise the few bad reviews would have kept me away. Unfortunately, the bad reviews here are 100% correct so let me just recap. Don't go to this hotel if you plan on sleeping at night. Maybe if you want to sleep from 5am until noon, but otherwise forget it. The bass from the club is so loud it sounds like it's in your room (and our room was no where near the club!) Also, there were some people who snuck out onto the rooftop right outside our window and camped out there until 5am. Yes folks, 5 am - laughing and hollering and stomping their feet! The hotel puts earplugs in the room but they didn't help at all. Also our Hvac unit was broken so our room was 82 degrees. Phone was broken too so forget about calling the front desk to rat out the people on the roof. Pros: Door men are very helpful and friendly, especially Tony. We did complain about the intense heat in our room which the hotel staff did fix. We also complained about the rooftop partiers the next morning and within moments, staff was on site screwing the windows shut so that it couldn't happen again. Cons: WAY too much noise. Too many defects. Dull dim lighting in the bathroom so you can't make sure you look decent before you go out. The hotwire rate was nice, but you really do get what you pay for sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: princessharley
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel ... the location can't be beat ... our room was beautiful ... the service was great ... the restaurant was fantastic and the the outdoor lounge was perfect for spending time with friends having some cocktails and people watching!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bettyz
Reviews.Content: I am not a high maintenance hotel stayer. I like modern, clean rooms with a location central to my interests. The Opus delivered on both of those. Having said that, there was one BIG problem. The sound! I am a 30 year old woman. I love to party and stay out late...however, when I am ready to go to sleep, I want to be able to. There are 2 sides to this hotel. One faces the ultra hip, posh, overly priced restaurant/club Koko..the other faces the busy street. I don't know how the sound is on the street side, but on the club side it's obnoxiously loud!! Until 3-4 am on the weekends and about 2 on the weeknights. One day, we had been sightseeing all day and wanted to ttake a nap to be ready to go out later. There was a wedding in the courtyard of the restaurant and they started playing music at 5-6 pm (and it was still going when we got home late night). The music was typical annoying wedding music and top it all off, we had to hear all the speeches in surround sound. The volume was 19 on a scale of 1-20. We were very irritated and did not feel rested upon leaving this hotel. The staff is on the snobby side, and definitely cater more to the trendsetters, than the average joes. Room service stops serving at 11 pm..at least if you're going to force me to stay awake hearing your music..feed me! BUT the location is fantastic!! A few blocks from St Denis and the Latin Quarter, right on St Laurent with limitless restaurants and bars, a few blocks from Old Montreal, Prince Arthur Street, St Catherine, the metro, buses etc I would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved , loved, loved the Opus!!”
Reviews.Author: Lorleen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Opus Hotel in Monteal -June 27-30th while enjoying the Montreal Jazz Festival. It was hard to leave the hotel!!! From entering the lobby, we had incredible service right from the moment we entereded the front doors. The front desk staff were efficient, welcoming and very polite. Security is great, since you require your room key to access your floor inside the elevator. Decor is great, ultra modern, a nice change from the "typical" decor of hotels. There is an area, just adjacent to the lobby where there is a free,fresh coffee and tea bar with very comfy sofas and chairs and free wireless hookups.The various daily papers are free as well. Our room was just perfect!!! The colors are all spectacular and each is different, hot pink, mustard, chartrusse, and our was purple, mauve and grey! We loved it- the king bed was incredible, the linens were the best I've ever slept on in any hotel! (HMMMM- do they sell them?) The room was very large, comfortable, and a bonus was that the window opened-we stayed on the 4th floor overtop the covered patio area and off to a side street. We did not have any noise problems. Our window when closed was very soundproof. We also found an "O" umbrella in our closet - which came in very handy. The bath products are great, they use L'Occitane en Provence- very luxurious! Nice white fluffy bathrobes (with a lime green "O" -very cute)- huge shower was a nice treat too! The lighting in the room is great - no ceiling lights, but instead, lamps and recessed lighting in one wall behind the bed. In the evening we had turndown service with decadant chocolates on our pillow, soft romantic lighting, the beautiful copper roman shade drawn- and the silver ice bucket full- ready for our nightcaps!! The lounge and restaurant are elegant- the outdoor courtyard very stylish and one floor below at Suko's Lounge- the outdoor patio is just decadant- chaise lounges and pillows surrounded by a great garden area, accessable right to the street. We were only blocks away from the Jazz Fest and steps away from Old Montreal, fantastic shops, restaurants (Thanks to Fritz!! for the tips on breakfast and lunch spots!!) wine bars, great patios, I could go on and on. But bottom line, if you want to stay in a GREAT hotel, in a perfect location - you cannot miss with the Opus Hotel. We heard that they have an Opus in Vancouver and can't wait to experience the BC one soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Opus”
Reviews.Author: thebunter
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay at the Opus and could not have been happier with our choice. As always I use Tripadvisor as my guide before booking a hotel and although there have been a couple of poor ratings for this hotel it certainly was not our experience. The hotel is very modern, clean and staff extremely helpful from the front desk staff to the doormen. We did not experience any of the problems with sound in the room at all. Location is excellent. The only complaint I have is that the food and bar prices are "way" too high and would definitely not avail myself of either the restaurant or bar. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe for some people...”
Reviews.Author: jnny5
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay over a month in advance with Tablet Hotels. The money had been paid to the hotel in it's entirety 3 weeks before I had even arrived, yet there was no room waiting for me. I immediately noticed that Opus is definitely going for a specific clientele. Young professionals, or celebrities with money to burn will enjoy extra-special attention from the staff, while those like myself will get a bit of the old 'upturned nose' treatment. When I was finally able to get a room one of the concierge at the front desk said to me that he'd like to find me a quieter room, when he saw the one that was assigned by the woman who had originally greeted us, but was abruptly cut off by her as she told him that our room was "fine". Beware that if you plan on going to bed before 3am, half of the hotel's rooms overlook the courtyard which Koko (the upscale yuppie hotel restaurant/nightclub) opens onto. Our room was the floor above the courtyard and was vibrating from the bass in the restaurant's sound-system and we could clearly hear the people in the courtyard smoking and yelling to one another over the music. When I called to ask for a different room, I was told that the hotel was "Sold Out". This is a *likely story*. The decoration/design of this hotel is very trendy, and while it is nice right now, it is very dark and will date quickly. If you like to stay up late snorting coke, drinking awesome martinis and partying with other yuppies, you will love Opus Hotel in Montreal. This is not a family hotel, nor is it a hotel for people who like a peaceful or relaxing weekend away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Believe the other reviews, WORST HOTEL WE EVER STAYED IN.”
Reviews.Author: hellas79
